built with pdoc

pyMBE 

   1class pymbe_library():
   2    """
   3    The library for the Molecular Builder for ESPResSo (pyMBE)
   4
   5    Attributes:
   6        N_A(`obj`): Avogadro number using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry.
   7        Kb(`obj`): Boltzmann constant using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry.
   8        e(`obj`): Elemental charge using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry.
   9        df(`obj`): PandasDataframe used to bookkeep all the information stored in pyMBE. Typically refered as `pmb.df`. 
  10        kT(`obj`): Thermal energy using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. It is used as the unit of reduced energy.
  11    """
  12    import pint
  13    import re
  14    import numpy as np
  15    import pandas as pd 
  16    import json
  17    from scipy import optimize
  18    units = pint.UnitRegistry()
  19    N_A=6.02214076e23    / units.mol
  20    Kb=1.38064852e-23    * units.J / units.K
  21    e=1.60217662e-19 *units.C
  22    df=None
  23    kT=None
  24
  25    def __init__(self, temperature=None, unit_length=None, unit_charge=None):
  26        """
  27        Initializes the pymbe_library by setting up the reduced unit system with `temperature` and `reduced_length` 
  28        and sets up  the `pmb.df` for bookkeeping.
  29
  30        Args:
  31            temperature(`obj`,optional): Value of the temperature in the pyMBE UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
  32            unit_length(`obj`, optional): Value of the unit of length in the pyMBE UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
  33            unit_charge (`obj`,optional): Reduced unit of charge defined using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. Defaults to None. 
  34        
  35        Note:
  36            - If no `temperature` is given, a value of 298.15 K is assumed by default.
  37            - If no `unit_length` is given, a value of 0.355 nm is assumed by default.
  38            - If no `unit_charge` is given, a value of 1 elementary charge is assumed by default. 
  39        """
  40        # Default definitions of reduced units
  41        if temperature is None:
  42            temperature= 298.15 * self.units.K
  43        if unit_length is None:
  44            unit_length= 0.355 * self.units.nm
  45        if unit_charge is None:
  46            unit_charge=self.units.e
  47        self.kT=temperature*self.Kb
  48        self.units.define(f'reduced_energy = {self.kT}')
  49        self.units.define(f'reduced_length = {unit_length}')
  50        self.units.define(f'reduced_charge = 1*e')
  51        self.setup_df()
  52        return
  53    
  54    def activate_motion_of_rigid_object(self, name, espresso_system):
  55        '''
  56        Activates the motion of the rigid object `name` in the `espresso_system`.
  57
  58        Args:
  59            name(`str`): Label of the object.
  60            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
  61
  62        Note:
  63            - It requires that espressomd has the following features activated: ["VIRTUAL_SITES_RELATIVE", "MASS"].
  64        '''
  65        print ('activate_motion_of_rigid_object requires that espressomd has the following features activated: ["VIRTUAL_SITES_RELATIVE", "MASS"]')
  66        pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]
  67        if pmb_type != 'protein':
  68            raise ValueError (f'The pmb_type: {pmb_type} is not currently supported. The supported pmb_type is: protein')
  69        molecule_ids_list = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].molecule_id.to_list()
  70        for molecule_id in molecule_ids_list:    
  71            particle_ids_list = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].particle_id.dropna().to_list()
  72            center_of_mass = self.calculate_center_of_mass_of_molecule ( molecule_id=molecule_id,espresso_system=espresso_system)
  73            rigid_object_center = espresso_system.part.add(pos=center_of_mass,
  74                                                           rotation=[True,True,True], 
  75                                                           type=self.propose_unused_type())
  76            for particle_id in particle_ids_list:
  77                pid = espresso_system.part.by_id(particle_id)
  78                pid.vs_auto_relate_to(rigid_object_center.id)
  79        return
  80
  81    def add_bond_in_df(self, particle_id1, particle_id2, use_default_bond=False):
  82        """
  83        Adds a bond entry on the `pymbe.df` storing the particle_ids of the two bonded particles.
  84
  85        Args:
  86            particle_id1 (`int`): particle_id of the type of the first particle type of the bonded particles
  87            particle_id2 (`int`): particle_id of the type of the second particle type of the bonded particles
  88            use_default_bond (`bool`, optional): Controls if a bond of type `default` is used to bond particle whose bond types are not defined in `pmb.df`. Defaults to False.
  89        """
  90        particle_name1 = self.df.loc[self.df['particle_id']==particle_id1].name.values[0]
  91        particle_name2 = self.df.loc[self.df['particle_id']==particle_id2].name.values[0]
  92        bond_key = self.find_bond_key(particle_name1=particle_name1,
  93                                    particle_name2=particle_name2, 
  94                                    use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
  95        if not bond_key:
  96            return
  97        self.copy_df_entry(name=bond_key,column_name='particle_id2',number_of_copies=1)
  98        indexs = self.np.where(self.df['name']==bond_key)
  99        index_list = list (indexs[0])
 100        used_bond_df = self.df.loc[self.df['particle_id2'].notnull()]
 101        #without this drop the program crashes when dropping duplicates because the 'bond' column is a dict
 102        used_bond_df = used_bond_df.drop([('bond_object','')],axis =1 )
 103        if len(used_bond_df.index) > 1: 
 104            used_bond_df = used_bond_df.drop_duplicates(keep='first')
 105        used_bond_index = used_bond_df.index.to_list()
 106        for index in index_list:
 107            if index not in used_bond_index:
 108                self.clean_df_row(index=int(index))
 109                self.df.at[index,'particle_id'] = particle_id1
 110                self.df.at[index,'particle_id2'] = particle_id2
 111                break
 112        return
 113
 114    def add_bonds_to_espresso(self, espresso_system) :
 115        """
 116        Adds all bonds defined in `pmb.df` to `espresso_system`.
 117
 118        Args:
 119            espresso_system (str): system object of espressomd library
 120        """
 121
 122        if 'bond' in self.df.values:
 123            bond_df = self.df.loc[self.df ['pmb_type'] == 'bond']
 124            bond_list = bond_df.bond_object.values.tolist()
 125            for bond in bond_list:
 126                espresso_system.bonded_inter.add(bond)
 127        else:
 128            print ('WARNING: There are no bonds defined in pymbe.df')
 129        
 130        return
 131
 132    def add_value_to_df(self,index,key,new_value, warning=True):
 133        """
 134        Adds a value to a cell in the `pmb.df` DataFrame.
 135
 136        Args:
 137            index(`int`): index of the row to add the value to.
 138            key(`str`): the column label to add the value to.
 139            warning(`bool`, optional): If true, prints a warning if a value is being overwritten in `pmb.df`. Defaults to true.
 140        """
 141        # Make sure index is a scalar integer value
 142        index = int (index)
 143        assert isinstance(index, int), '`index` should be a scalar integer value.'
 144        idx = self.pd.IndexSlice
 145        if self.check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(index=index,key=key):
 146            old_value= self.df.loc[index,idx[key]]
 147            if warning:
 148                if old_value != new_value:
 149                    name=self.df.loc[index,('name','')]
 150                    pmb_type=self.df.loc[index,('pmb_type','')]
 151                    print(f"WARNING: you are redefining the properties of {name} of pmb_type {pmb_type}")
 152                    print(f'WARNING: overwritting the value of the entry `{key}`: old_value = {old_value} new_value = {new_value}')
 153        self.df.loc[index,idx[key]] = new_value
 154        return
 155    
 156    def assign_molecule_id(self, name, molecule_index, pmb_type, used_molecules_id):
 157        """
 158        Assigns the `molecule_id` of the pmb object given by `pmb_type`
 159        
 160        Args:
 161            name(`str`): Label of the molecule type to be created. `name` must be defined in `pmb.df`
 162            pmb_type(`str`): pmb_object_type to assign the `molecule_id` 
 163            molecule_index (`int`): index of the current `pmb_object_type` to assign the `molecule_id`
 164            used_molecules_id (`lst`): list with the `molecule_id` values already used.
 165        
 166        Returns:
 167            molecule_id(`int`): Id of the molecule
 168        """
 169
 170        self.clean_df_row(index=int(molecule_index))
 171        
 172        if self.df['molecule_id'].isnull().values.all():
 173            molecule_id = 0        
 174        else:
 175            # check if a residue is part of another molecule
 176            check_residue_name = self.df[self.df['residue_list'].astype(str).str.contains(name)]
 177            pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]                
 178            if not check_residue_name.empty and pmb_type == pmb_type :              
 179                for value in check_residue_name.index.to_list():                  
 180                    if value not in used_molecules_id:                              
 181                        molecule_id = self.df.loc[value].molecule_id.values[0]                    
 182                        break
 183            else:
 184                molecule_id = self.df['molecule_id'].max() +1
 185
 186        self.add_value_to_df (key=('molecule_id',''),
 187                                index=int(molecule_index),
 188                                new_value=molecule_id, 
 189                                warning=False)
 190
 191        return molecule_id
 192    
 193    def calculate_center_of_mass_of_molecule(self, molecule_id, espresso_system):
 194        """
 195        Calculates the center of mass of type `name`.
 196
 197        Args:
 198            molecule_id(`int`): Id of the molecule to be centered.
 199            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
 200        
 201        Returns:
 202            center_of_mass(`lst`): Coordinates of the center of mass.
 203        """
 204        total_beads = 0
 205        center_of_mass = self.np.zeros(3)
 206        axis_list = [0,1,2]
 207        particle_id_list = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].particle_id.dropna().to_list()
 208        for pid in particle_id_list:
 209            total_beads +=1 
 210            for axis in axis_list:
 211                center_of_mass [axis] += espresso_system.part.by_id(pid).pos[axis]
 212        center_of_mass = center_of_mass /total_beads  
 213        return center_of_mass
 214
 215    def calculate_HH(self, object_name, pH_list=None, pka_set=None):
 216        """
 217        Calculates the charge per molecule according to the ideal Henderson-Hasselbalch titration curve 
 218        for molecules with the name `object_name`.
 219
 220        Args:
 221            object_name (`str`): name of the molecule to calculate the ideal charge for
 222            pH_list(`lst`): pH-values to calculate. 
 223            pka_set(`dict`): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}
 224
 225        Returns:
 226            Z_HH (`lst`): Henderson-Hasselbalch prediction of the charge of `sequence` in `pH_list`
 227
 228        Note:
 229            - This function supports objects with pmb types: "molecule", "peptide" and "protein".
 230            - If no `pH_list` is given, 50 equispaced pH-values ranging from 2 to 12 are calculated
 231            - If no `pka_set` is given, the pKa values are taken from `pmb.df`
 232            - This function should only be used for single-phase systems. For two-phase systems `calculate_HH_Donnan` has to be used.
 233        """
 234        if pH_list is None:
 235            pH_list=self.np.linspace(2,12,50)    
 236        if pka_set is None:
 237            pka_set=self.get_pka_set() 
 238        self.check_pka_set(pka_set=pka_set)
 239        charge_map = self.get_charge_map()
 240        Z_HH=[]
 241        for pH_value in pH_list:    
 242            Z=0
 243            index = self.df.loc[self.df['name'] == object_name].index[0].item() 
 244            residue_list = self.df.at [index,('residue_list','')]
 245            sequence = self.df.at [index,('sequence','')]
 246            if self.np.any(self.pd.isnull(sequence)):
 247                # Molecule has no sequence
 248                for residue in residue_list:
 249                    list_of_particles_in_residue = self.search_particles_in_residue(residue)
 250                    for particle in list_of_particles_in_residue:
 251                        if particle in pka_set.keys():
 252                            if pka_set[particle]['acidity'] == 'acidic':
 253                                psi=-1
 254                            elif pka_set[particle]['acidity']== 'basic':
 255                                psi=+1
 256                            else:
 257                                psi=0
 258                            Z+=psi/(1+10**(psi*(pH_value-pka_set[particle]['pka_value'])))                      
 259                Z_HH.append(Z)
 260            else:
 261                # Molecule has a sequence
 262                if not isinstance(sequence, list):
 263                    # If the df has been read by file, the sequence needs to be parsed.
 264                    sequence = self.parse_sequence_from_file(sequence=sequence)
 265                for name in sequence:
 266                    if name in pka_set.keys():
 267                        if pka_set[name]['acidity'] == 'acidic':
 268                            psi=-1
 269                        elif pka_set[name]['acidity']== 'basic':
 270                            psi=+1
 271                        else:
 272                            psi=0
 273                        Z+=psi/(1+10**(psi*(pH_value-pka_set[name]['pka_value'])))
 274                    else:
 275                        state_one_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_one.es_type.values[0]
 276                        Z+=charge_map[state_one_type]
 277                Z_HH.append(Z)
 278
 279        return Z_HH
 280
 281    def calculate_HH_Donnan(self, espresso_system, object_names, c_salt, pH_list=None, pka_set=None):
 282        """
 283        Calculates the charge on the different molecules according to the Henderson-Hasselbalch equation coupled to the Donnan partitioning.
 284
 285        Args:
 286            object_names ('lst'): List of the object names of all (potentially) charged molecules in the system.
 287            c_salt ('float'): Salt concentration in the reservoir.
 288            pH_list ('lst'): List of pH-values in the reservoir. 
 289            pka_set ('dict'): {"name": {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}.
 290
 291        Returns:
 292            {"charges_dict": {"name": charges}, "pH_system_list": pH_system_list, "partition_coefficients": partition_coefficients_list}
 293            pH_system_list ('lst'): List of pH_values in the system.
 294            partition_coefficients_list ('lst'): List of partition coefficients of cations.
 295
 296        Note:
 297            - If no `pH_list` is given, 50 equispaced pH-values ranging from 2 to 12 are calculated
 298            - If no `pka_set` is given, the pKa values are taken from `pmb.df`
 299            - If `object_names` does not contain the object names of all (potentially) charged molecules in the system, the calculation will give a wrong result.
 300        """
 301        if pH_list is None:
 302            pH_list=self.np.linspace(2,12,50)    
 303        if pka_set is None:
 304            pka_set=self.get_pka_set() 
 305        self.check_pka_set(pka_set=pka_set)
 306
 307        partition_coefficients_list = []
 308        pH_system_list = []
 309        Z_HH_Donnan={}
 310        concentrations_molecules={}
 311        for key in object_names:
 312            Z_HH_Donnan[key] = []
 313            # Calculate the concentrations of the different types of molecules
 314            concentrations_molecules[key] = (len(self.df.loc[self.df['name'] == key].index) / (self.N_A * self.units.Quantity(espresso_system.volume(), 'reduced_length**3'))).to('mol/liter')
 315
 316        def calc_charges(object_names, pH):
 317            """
 318            Calculates the charges of the different kinds of molecules according to the Henderson-Hasselbalch equation.
 319
 320            Args:
 321                object_names ('lst'): List of the object names of all (potentially) charged molecules in the system.
 322                pH ('float'): pH-value that is used in the HH equation.
 323
 324            Returns:
 325                charge ('dict'): {"molecule_name": charge}
 326            """
 327            charge = {}
 328            for name in object_names:
 329                charge[name] = self.calculate_HH(name, [pH], pka_set)[0]
 330            return charge
 331
 332        def calc_partition_coefficient(charge, concentrations_molecules):
 333            """
 334            Calculates the partition coefficients of positive ions according to the ideal Donnan theory.
 335
 336            Args:
 337                charge ('dict'): {"molecule_name": charge}
 338                concentrations_molecules ('dict'): {"molecule_name": concentration}.
 339            """
 340            nonlocal ionic_strength_res
 341            charge_density = 0.0
 342            for key in charge:
 343                charge_density += charge[key] * concentrations_molecules[key]
 344            return (-charge_density / (2 * ionic_strength_res) + self.np.sqrt((charge_density / (2 * ionic_strength_res))**2 + 1)).magnitude
 345
 346        for pH_value in pH_list:    
 347            # calculate the ionic strength of the reservoir
 348            if pH_value <= 7.0:
 349                ionic_strength_res = 10 ** (-pH_value) * self.units.mol/self.units.l + c_salt 
 350            elif pH_value > 7.0:
 351                ionic_strength_res = 10 ** (-(14-pH_value)) * self.units.mol/self.units.l + c_salt
 352
 353            #Determine the partition coefficient of positive ions by solving the system of nonlinear, coupled equations
 354            #consisting of the partition coefficient given by the ideal Donnan theory and the Henderson-Hasselbalch equation.
 355            #The nonlinear equation is formulated for log(xi) since log-operations are not supported for RootResult objects.
 356            equation = lambda logxi: logxi - self.np.log10(calc_partition_coefficient(calc_charges(object_names, pH_value - logxi), concentrations_molecules))
 357            logxi = self.optimize.root_scalar(equation, bracket=[-1e2, 1e2], method="brentq")
 358            partition_coefficient = 10**logxi.root
 359
 360            charges_temp = calc_charges(object_names, pH_value-self.np.log10(partition_coefficient))
 361            for key in object_names:
 362                Z_HH_Donnan[key].append(charges_temp[key])
 363
 364            pH_system_list.append(pH_value - self.np.log10(partition_coefficient))
 365            partition_coefficients_list.append(partition_coefficient)
 366
 367        return {"charges_dict": Z_HH_Donnan, "pH_system_list": pH_system_list, "partition_coefficients": partition_coefficients_list}
 368
 369    def calculate_initial_bond_length(self, bond_object, bond_type, epsilon, sigma, cutoff):
 370        """
 371        Calculates the initial bond length that is used when setting up molecules,
 372        based on the minimum of the sum of bonded and short-range (LJ) interactions.
 373        
 374        Args:
 375            bond_object (`cls`): instance of a bond object from espressomd library
 376            bond_type (`str`): label identifying the used bonded potential
 377            epsilon (`float`): LJ epsilon of the interaction between the particles
 378            sigma (`float`): LJ sigma of the interaction between the particles
 379            cutoff (`float`): cutoff-radius of the LJ interaction 
 380        """    
 381        def truncated_lj_potential(x, epsilon, sigma, cutoff):
 382            if x>cutoff:
 383                return 0.0
 384            else:
 385                return 4*epsilon*((sigma/x)**12-(sigma/x)**6) - 4*epsilon*((sigma/cutoff)**12-(sigma/cutoff)**6)
 386
 387        epsilon_red=epsilon.to('reduced_energy').magnitude
 388        sigma_red=sigma.to('reduced_length').magnitude
 389        cutoff_red=cutoff.to('reduced_length').magnitude
 390
 391        if bond_type == "harmonic":
 392               r_0 = bond_object.params.get('r_0')
 393               k = bond_object.params.get('k')
 394               l0 = self.optimize.minimize(lambda x: 0.5*k*(x-r_0)**2 + truncated_lj_potential(x, epsilon_red, sigma_red, cutoff_red), x0=r_0).x
 395        elif bond_type == "FENE":
 396               r_0 = bond_object.params.get('r_0')
 397               k = bond_object.params.get('k')
 398               d_r_max = bond_object.params.get('d_r_max')
 399               l0 = self.optimize.minimize(lambda x: -0.5*k*(d_r_max**2)*self.np.log(1-((x-r_0)/d_r_max)**2) + truncated_lj_potential(x, epsilon_red, sigma_red, cutoff_red), x0=1.0).x
 400        return l0
 401
 402    def calculate_net_charge (self, espresso_system, molecule_name):
 403        '''
 404        Calculates the net charge per molecule of molecules with `name` = object_name. 
 405        Returns the net charge per molecule and a maps with the net charge per residue and molecule.
 406
 407        Args:
 408            espresso_system: system information 
 409            object_name (str): name of the molecule to calculate the net charge
 410
 411        Returns:
 412            {"mean": mean_net_charge, "molecules": {mol_id: net_charge_of_mol_id, }, "residues": {res_id: net_charge_of_res_id, }}
 413
 414        Note:
 415            - The net charge of the molecule is averaged over all molecules of type `name` 
 416            - The net charge of each particle type is averaged over all particle of the same type in all molecules of type `name`
 417        '''        
 418        valid_pmb_types = ["molecule", "protein"]
 419        pmb_type=self.df.loc[self.df['name']==molecule_name].pmb_type.values[0]
 420        if pmb_type not in valid_pmb_types:
 421            raise ValueError("The pyMBE object with name {object_name} has a pmb_type {pmb_type}. This function only supports pyMBE types {valid_pmb_types}")      
 422        charge_in_residues = {}
 423        id_map = self.get_particle_id_map(object_name=molecule_name)
 424        def create_charge_map(espresso_system,id_map,label):
 425            charge_map={}
 426            for super_id in id_map[label].keys():
 427                net_charge=0
 428                for pid in id_map[label][super_id]:
 429                    net_charge+=espresso_system.part.by_id(pid).q
 430                charge_map[super_id]=net_charge
 431            return charge_map
 432        net_charge_molecules=create_charge_map(label="molecule_map",
 433                                                espresso_system=espresso_system,
 434                                                id_map=id_map)
 435        net_charge_residues=create_charge_map(label="residue_map",
 436                                                espresso_system=espresso_system,
 437                                                id_map=id_map)       
 438        mean_charge=self.np.mean(self.np.array(list(net_charge_molecules.values())))
 439        return {"mean": mean_charge, "molecules": net_charge_molecules, "residues": net_charge_residues}
 440
 441    def center_molecule_in_simulation_box(self, molecule_id, espresso_system):
 442        """
 443        Centers the pmb object matching `molecule_id` in the center of the simulation box in `espresso_md`.
 444        
 445        Args:
 446            molecule_id(`int`): Id of the molecule to be centered.
 447            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
 448        """
 449        center_of_mass = self.calculate_center_of_mass_of_molecule ( molecule_id=molecule_id,espresso_system=espresso_system)
 450        box_center = [espresso_system.box_l[0]/2.0]*3
 451        pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].pmb_type.values[0]
 452        pmb_objects = ['protein','molecule','peptide']
 453        if pmb_type in pmb_objects:
 454            particle_id_list = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].particle_id.dropna().to_list()
 455            for pid in particle_id_list:
 456                es_pos = espresso_system.part.by_id(pid).pos
 457                espresso_system.part.by_id(pid).pos = es_pos - center_of_mass + box_center
 458        return 
 459
 460    def check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(self, index,key):
 461        """
 462        Checks if a cell in the `pmb.df` at the specified index and column has a value.
 463
 464        Args:
 465            index(`int`): Index of the row to check.
 466            key(`str`): Column label to check.
 467
 468        Returns:
 469            `bool`: `True` if the cell has a value, `False` otherwise.
 470        """
 471        idx = self.pd.IndexSlice
 472        return not self.pd.isna(self.df.loc[index, idx[key]])
 473
 474    def check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(self, name, pmb_type_to_be_defined):
 475        """
 476        Checks if `name` is defined in `pmb.df`.
 477
 478        Args:
 479            name(`str`): label to check if defined in `pmb.df`.
 480            pmb_type_to_be_defined(`str`): pmb object type corresponding to `name`.
 481
 482        Returns:
 483            `bool`: `True` for success, `False` otherwise.
 484        """
 485        if name in self.df['name'].unique():
 486            current_object_type = self.df[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]
 487            if current_object_type != pmb_type_to_be_defined:
 488                raise ValueError ((f"The name {name} is already defined in the df with a pmb_type = {current_object_type}, pymMBE does not support objects with the same name but different pmb_types"))    
 489            return True            
 490        else:
 491            return False
 492
 493    def check_pka_set(self, pka_set):
 494        """
 495        Checks that `pka_set` has the formatting expected by the pyMBE library.
 496       
 497        Args:
 498            pka_set (dict): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}
 499        """
 500        required_keys=['pka_value','acidity']
 501        for required_key in required_keys:
 502            for pka_entry in pka_set.values():
 503                if required_key not in pka_entry.keys():
 504                    raise ValueError('missing a requiered key ', required_keys, 'in the following entry of pka_set', pka_entry)
 505        return
 506
 507    def clean_df_row(self, index, columns_keys_to_clean=["particle_id", "particle_id2", "residue_id", "molecule_id"]):
 508        """
 509        Cleans the columns of `pmb.df` in `columns_keys_to_clean` of the row with index `index` by assigning them a np.nan value.
 510
 511        Args:
 512            index(`int`): Index of the row to clean.
 513            columns_keys_to_clean(`list` of `str`, optional): List with the column keys to be cleaned. Defaults to [`particle_id`, `particle_id2`, `residue_id`, `molecule_id`].
 514        """   
 515        for column_key in columns_keys_to_clean:
 516            self.add_value_to_df(key=(column_key,''),index=index,new_value=self.np.nan, warning=False)
 517        return
 518
 519    def copy_df_entry(self, name, column_name, number_of_copies):
 520        '''
 521        Creates 'number_of_copies' of a given 'name' in `pymbe.df`.
 522
 523        Args:
 524            name(`str`): Label of the particle/residue/molecule type to be created. `name` must be defined in `pmb.df`
 525            column_name(`str`): Column name to use as a filter. 
 526            number_of_copies(`int`): number of copies of `name` to be created.
 527        
 528        Note:
 529            - Currently, column_name only supports "particle_id", "particle_id2", "residue_id" and "molecule_id" 
 530        '''
 531
 532        valid_column_names=["particle_id", "residue_id", "molecule_id", "particle_id2" ]
 533        if column_name not in valid_column_names:
 534            raise ValueError(f"{column_name} is not a valid column_name, currently only the following are supported: {valid_column_names}")
 535        df_by_name = self.df.loc[self.df.name == name]
 536        if number_of_copies != 1:           
 537            if df_by_name[column_name].isnull().values.any():       
 538                    df_by_name_repeated = self.pd.concat ([df_by_name]*(number_of_copies-1), ignore_index=True)
 539            else:
 540                df_by_name = df_by_name[df_by_name.index == df_by_name.index.min()] 
 541                df_by_name_repeated = self.pd.concat ([df_by_name]*(number_of_copies), ignore_index=True)
 542                df_by_name_repeated[column_name] =self.np.NaN
 543            # Concatenate the new particle rows to  `df`
 544            self.df = self.pd.concat ([self.df,df_by_name_repeated], ignore_index=True)
 545        else:
 546            if not df_by_name[column_name].isnull().values.any():     
 547                df_by_name = df_by_name[df_by_name.index == df_by_name.index.min()] 
 548                df_by_name_repeated = self.pd.concat ([df_by_name]*(number_of_copies), ignore_index=True)
 549                df_by_name_repeated[column_name] =self.np.NaN
 550                self.df = self.pd.concat ([self.df,df_by_name_repeated], ignore_index=True)        
 551        return
 552
 553    def create_added_salt (self, espresso_system, cation_name, anion_name, c_salt):    
 554        """
 555        Creates a `c_salt` concentration of `cation_name` and `anion_name` ions into the `espresso_system`.
 556
 557        Args:
 558            espresso_system (`obj`): instance of an espresso system object.
 559            cation_name(`str`): `name` of a particle with a positive charge.
 560            anion_name(`str`): `name` of a particle with a negative charge.
 561            c_salt (float): Salt concentration. 
 562            
 563        Returns:
 564            c_salt_calculated (float): Calculated salt concentration added to `espresso_system`.
 565        """
 566        cation_name_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==cation_name].state_one.charge.values[0]
 567        anion_name_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==anion_name].state_one.charge.values[0]     
 568        if cation_name_charge <= 0:
 569            raise ValueError('ERROR cation charge must be positive, charge ',cation_name_charge)
 570        if anion_name_charge >= 0:
 571            raise ValueError('ERROR anion charge must be negative, charge ', anion_name_charge)
 572        # Calculate the number of ions in the simulation box
 573        volume=self.units.Quantity(espresso_system.volume(), 'reduced_length**3')
 574        if c_salt.check('[substance] [length]**-3'):
 575            N_ions= int((volume*c_salt.to('mol/reduced_length**3')*self.N_A).magnitude)
 576            c_salt_calculated=N_ions/(volume*self.N_A)
 577        elif c_salt.check('[length]**-3'):
 578            N_ions= int((volume*c_salt.to('reduced_length**-3')*self.N_A).magnitude)
 579            c_salt_calculated=N_ions/volume
 580        else:
 581            raise ValueError('Unknown units for c_salt, please provided it in [mol / volume] or [particle / volume]', c_salt)
 582        N_cation = N_ions*abs(anion_name_charge)
 583        N_anion = N_ions*abs(cation_name_charge)
 584        self.create_particle(espresso_system=espresso_system, name=cation_name, number_of_particles=N_cation)
 585        self.create_particle(espresso_system=espresso_system, name=anion_name, number_of_particles=N_anion)
 586        print('\n Added salt concentration of ', c_salt_calculated.to('mol/L'), 'given by ', N_cation, ' cations and ', N_anion, ' anions')
 587        return c_salt_calculated
 588
 589    def create_counterions(self, object_name, cation_name, anion_name, espresso_system):
 590        """
 591        Creates particles of `cation_name` and `anion_name` in `espresso_system` to counter the net charge of `pmb_object`.
 592        
 593        Args:
 594            object_name(`str`): `name` of a pymbe object.
 595            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
 596            cation_name(`str`): `name` of a particle with a positive charge.
 597            anion_name(`str`): `name` of a particle with a negative charge.
 598
 599        Returns: 
 600            counterion_number (dict): {"name": number}
 601        """
 602        cation_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==cation_name].state_one.charge.iloc[0]
 603        anion_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==anion_name].state_one.charge.iloc[0]
 604        object_ids = self.get_particle_id_map(object_name=object_name)["all"]
 605        counterion_number={}
 606        object_charge={}
 607        for name in ['positive', 'negative']:
 608            object_charge[name]=0
 609        for id in object_ids:
 610            if espresso_system.part.by_id(id).q > 0:
 611                object_charge['positive']+=1*(self.np.abs(espresso_system.part.by_id(id).q ))
 612            elif espresso_system.part.by_id(id).q < 0:
 613                object_charge['negative']+=1*(self.np.abs(espresso_system.part.by_id(id).q ))
 614        if (object_charge['positive'] % abs(anion_charge) == 0):
 615            counterion_number[anion_name]=int(object_charge['positive']/abs(anion_charge))
 616        else:
 617            raise ValueError('The number of positive charges in the pmb_object must be divisible by the  charge of the anion')
 618        if (object_charge['negative'] % abs(cation_charge) == 0):
 619            counterion_number[cation_name]=int(object_charge['negative']/cation_charge)
 620        else:
 621            raise ValueError('The number of negative charges in the pmb_object must be divisible by the  charge of the cation')
 622        if counterion_number[cation_name] > 0: 
 623            self.create_particle(espresso_system=espresso_system, name=cation_name, number_of_particles=counterion_number[cation_name])
 624        else:
 625            counterion_number[cation_name]=0
 626        if counterion_number[anion_name] > 0:
 627            self.create_particle(espresso_system=espresso_system, name=anion_name, number_of_particles=counterion_number[anion_name])
 628        else:
 629            counterion_number[anion_name] = 0
 630        print('The following counter-ions have been created: ')
 631        for name in counterion_number.keys():
 632            print(f'Ion type: {name} created number: {counterion_number[name]}')
 633        return counterion_number
 634
 635    def create_molecule(self, name, number_of_molecules, espresso_system, first_residue_position=None, use_default_bond=False):
 636        """
 637        Creates `number_of_molecules` molecule of type `name` into `espresso_system` and bookkeeps them into `pmb.df`.
 638
 639        Args:
 640            name(`str`): Label of the molecule type to be created. `name` must be defined in `pmb.df`
 641            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from espressomd library.
 642            number_of_molecules(`int`): Number of molecules of type `name` to be created.
 643            first_residue_position(`list`, optional): coordinates where the first_residue_position will be created, random by default
 644            use_default_bond(`bool`, optional): Controls if a bond of type `default` is used to bond particle with undefined bonds in `pymbe.df`
 645        Returns:
 646            molecules_info (`dict`):  {molecule_id: {residue_id:{"central_bead_id":central_bead_id, "side_chain_ids": [particle_id1, ...]}}} 
 647        """
 648        if number_of_molecules <= 0:
 649            return
 650        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,
 651                                                    pmb_type_to_be_defined='molecule'):
 652            raise ValueError(f"{name} must correspond to a label of a pmb_type='molecule' defined on df")
 653        first_residue = True
 654        molecule_info = []
 655        residue_list = self.df[self.df['name']==name].residue_list.values [0]
 656
 657        self.copy_df_entry(name=name,
 658                        column_name='molecule_id',
 659                        number_of_copies=number_of_molecules)
 660        
 661        molecules_index = self.np.where(self.df['name']==name)
 662        molecule_index_list =list(molecules_index[0])[-number_of_molecules:]
 663        used_molecules_id = self.df.molecule_id.dropna().drop_duplicates().tolist()
 664
 665        for molecule_index in molecule_index_list:         
 666
 667            molecule_id = self.assign_molecule_id (name=name,pmb_type='molecule',used_molecules_id=used_molecules_id,molecule_index=molecule_index)
 668
 669            for residue in residue_list:
 670                if first_residue:
 671                    residue_position = first_residue_position
 672                    backbone_vector = self.generate_trialvectors(center=[0,0,0], 
 673                                                                 radius=1, 
 674                                                                 n_samples=1,
 675                                                                 on_surface=True)[0]
 676                    residues_info = self.create_residue(name=residue,
 677                                                                    number_of_residues=1, 
 678                                                                    espresso_system=espresso_system, 
 679                                                                    central_bead_position=first_residue_position,  
 680                                                                    use_default_bond= use_default_bond, 
 681                                                                    backbone_vector=backbone_vector)
 682                    residue_id = next(iter(residues_info))
 683                    for index in self.df[self.df['residue_id']==residue_id].index:
 684                        self.add_value_to_df(key=('molecule_id',''),
 685                                            index=int (index),
 686                                            new_value=molecule_id)
 687                    central_bead_id = residues_info[residue_id]['central_bead_id']
 688                    previous_residue = residue
 689                    residue_position = espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).pos
 690                    previous_residue_id = central_bead_id
 691                    first_residue = False          
 692                else:                    
 693                    previous_central_bead_name=self.df[self.df['name']==previous_residue].central_bead.values[0]
 694                    new_central_bead_name=self.df[self.df['name']==residue].central_bead.values[0]       
 695                    bond = self.search_bond(particle_name1=previous_central_bead_name, 
 696                                            particle_name2=new_central_bead_name, 
 697                                            hard_check=True, 
 698                                            use_default_bond=use_default_bond)                
 699                    l0 = self.get_bond_length(particle_name1=previous_central_bead_name, 
 700                                              particle_name2=new_central_bead_name, 
 701                                              hard_check=True, 
 702                                              use_default_bond=use_default_bond)                
 703                    residue_position = residue_position+backbone_vector*l0
 704                    residues_info = self.create_residue(name=residue, 
 705                                                                    number_of_residues=1, 
 706                                                                    espresso_system=espresso_system, 
 707                                                                    central_bead_position=[residue_position],
 708                                                                    use_default_bond= use_default_bond)
 709                    residue_id = next(iter(residues_info))      
 710                    for index in self.df[self.df['residue_id']==residue_id].index:
 711                        if not self.check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(index=index,key=('molecule_id','')):
 712                            self.df.at[index,'molecule_id'] = molecule_id
 713                            self.add_value_to_df(key=('molecule_id',''),
 714                                                index=int (index),
 715                                                new_value=molecule_id,
 716                                                warning=False)            
 717                    central_bead_id = residues_info[residue_id]['central_bead_id']
 718                    espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).add_bond((bond, previous_residue_id))
 719                    self.add_bond_in_df(particle_id1=central_bead_id,
 720                                        particle_id2=previous_residue_id,
 721                                        use_default_bond=use_default_bond)            
 722                    previous_residue_id = central_bead_id
 723                    previous_residue = residue                    
 724                molecule_info.append(residues_info)
 725            first_residue = True
 726        return molecule_info
 727    
 728    def create_particle(self, name, espresso_system, number_of_particles, position=None, fix=False):
 729        """
 730        Creates `number_of_particles` particles of type `name` into `espresso_system` and bookkeeps them into `pymbe.df`.
 731        
 732        Args:
 733            name (`str`): Label of the particle type to be created. `name` must be a `particle` defined in `pmb_df`. 
 734            espresso_system (`cls`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
 735            number_of_particles (`int`): Number of particles to be created.
 736            position (list of [`float`,`float`,`float`], optional): Initial positions of the particles. If not given, particles are created in random positions. Defaults to None.
 737            fix(`bool`, optional): Controls if the particle motion is frozen in the integrator, it is used to create rigid objects. Defaults to False.
 738        Returns:
 739            created_pid_list(`list` of `float`): List with the ids of the particles created into `espresso_system`.
 740        """       
 741        if number_of_particles <=0:
 742            return
 743        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='particle'):
 744            raise ValueError(f"{name} must correspond to a label of a pmb_type='particle' defined on df")
 745        # Copy the data of the particle `number_of_particles` times in the `df`
 746        self.copy_df_entry(name=name,column_name='particle_id',number_of_copies=number_of_particles)
 747        # Get information from the particle type `name` from the df     
 748        q = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_one.charge.values[0]
 749        es_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_one.es_type.values[0]
 750        # Get a list of the index in `df` corresponding to the new particles to be created
 751        index = self.np.where(self.df['name']==name)
 752        index_list =list(index[0])[-number_of_particles:]
 753        # Create the new particles into  `espresso_system`
 754        created_pid_list=[]
 755        for index in range (number_of_particles):
 756            df_index=int (index_list[index])
 757            self.clean_df_row(index=df_index)
 758            if position is None:
 759                particle_position = self.np.random.random((1, 3))[0] *self.np.copy(espresso_system.box_l)
 760            else:
 761                particle_position = position[index]
 762            if len(espresso_system.part.all()) == 0:
 763                bead_id = 0
 764            else:
 765                bead_id = max (espresso_system.part.all().id) + 1
 766            created_pid_list.append(bead_id)
 767            
 768            if fix:
 769                espresso_system.part.add (id=bead_id, pos = particle_position, type = es_type, q = q,fix =[fix,fix,fix])        
 770            else:
 771                espresso_system.part.add (id=bead_id, pos = particle_position, type = es_type, q = q)        
 772            self.add_value_to_df(key=('particle_id',''),index=df_index,new_value=bead_id, warning=False)                  
 773        return created_pid_list
 774
 775    def create_pmb_object (self, name, number_of_objects, espresso_system, position=None, use_default_bond=False):
 776        """
 777        Creates all `particle`s associated to `pmb object` into  `espresso` a number of times equal to `number_of_objects`.
 778        
 779        Args:
 780            name(`str`): Unique label of the `pmb object` to be created. 
 781            number_of_objects(`int`): Number of `pmb object`s to be created.
 782            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of an espresso system object from espressomd library.
 783            position(`list`): Coordinates where the particles should be created.
 784            use_default_bond(`bool`,optional): Controls if a `default` bond is used to bond particles with undefined bonds in `pmb.df`. Defaults to `False`.
 785
 786        Note:
 787            - If no `position` is given, particles will be created in random positions. For bonded particles, they will be created at a distance equal to the bond length. 
 788        """
 789        allowed_objects=['particle','residue','molecule']
 790        pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]
 791        if pmb_type not in allowed_objects:
 792            raise ValueError('Object type not supported, supported types are ', allowed_objects)
 793        if pmb_type == 'particle':
 794            self.create_particle(name=name, number_of_particles=number_of_objects, espresso_system=espresso_system, position=position)
 795        elif pmb_type == 'residue':
 796            self.create_residue(name=name,number_of_residues=number_of_objects, espresso_system=espresso_system, central_bead_position=position,use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 797        elif pmb_type == 'molecule':
 798            self.create_molecule(name=name,number_of_molecules=number_of_objects, espresso_system=espresso_system, use_default_bond=use_default_bond, first_residue_position=position)
 799        return
 800
 801    def create_protein(self, name, number_of_proteins, espresso_system, topology_dict):
 802        """
 803        Creates `number_of_proteins` molecules of type `name` into `espresso_system` at the coordinates in `positions`
 804
 805        Args:
 806            name(`str`): Label of the protein to be created. 
 807            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
 808            number_of_proteins(`int`): Number of proteins to be created.
 809            positions(`dict`): {'ResidueNumber': {'initial_pos': [], 'chain_id': ''}}
 810        """
 811
 812        if number_of_proteins <=0:
 813            return
 814        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,
 815                                                  pmb_type_to_be_defined='protein'):
 816            raise ValueError(f"{name} must correspond to a name of a pmb_type='protein' defined on df")
 817
 818        self.copy_df_entry(name=name,column_name='molecule_id',number_of_copies=number_of_proteins)
 819
 820        protein_index = self.np.where(self.df['name']==name)
 821        protein_index_list =list(protein_index[0])[-number_of_proteins:]
 822        used_molecules_id = self.df.molecule_id.dropna().drop_duplicates().tolist()
 823        
 824        box_half=espresso_system.box_l[0]/2.0
 825
 826        for molecule_index in protein_index_list:     
 827
 828            molecule_id = self.assign_molecule_id (name=name,pmb_type='protein',used_molecules_id=used_molecules_id,molecule_index=molecule_index)
 829
 830            protein_center = self.generate_coordinates_outside_sphere(radius = 1, 
 831                                                                        max_dist=box_half, 
 832                                                                        n_samples=1, 
 833                                                                        center=[box_half]*3)[0]
 834   
 835            for residue in topology_dict.keys():
 836
 837                residue_name = self.re.split(r'\d+', residue)[0]
 838                residue_number = self.re.split(r'(\d+)', residue)[1]
 839                residue_position = topology_dict[residue]['initial_pos']
 840                position = residue_position + protein_center
 841
 842                particle_id = self.create_particle(name=residue_name,
 843                                                            espresso_system=espresso_system,
 844                                                            number_of_particles=1,
 845                                                            position=[position], 
 846                                                            fix = True)
 847
 848                index = self.df[self.df['particle_id']==particle_id[0]].index.values[0]
 849
 850                self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),
 851                                            index=int (index),
 852                                            new_value=residue_number)
 853
 854                self.add_value_to_df(key=('molecule_id',''),
 855                                        index=int (index),
 856                                        new_value=molecule_id)
 857
 858        return
 859
 860    def create_residue(self, name, espresso_system, number_of_residues, central_bead_position=None,use_default_bond=False, backbone_vector=None):
 861        """
 862        Creates `number_of_residues` residues of type `name` into `espresso_system` and bookkeeps them into `pmb.df`.
 863
 864        Args:
 865            name(`str`): Label of the residue type to be created. `name` must be defined in `pmb.df`
 866            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from espressomd library.
 867            number_of_residue(`int`): Number of residues of type `name` to be created.
 868            central_bead_position(`list` of `float`): Position of the central bead.
 869            use_default_bond (`bool`): Switch to control if a bond of type `default` is used to bond a particle whose bonds types are not defined in `pmb.df`
 870            backbone_vector (`list` of `float`): Backbone vector of the molecule. All side chains are created perpendicularly to `backbone_vector`.
 871
 872        Returns:
 873            residues_info (`dict`): {residue_id:{"central_bead_id":central_bead_id, "side_chain_ids":[particle_id1, ...]}}
 874        """
 875        if number_of_residues <= 0:
 876            return
 877        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,
 878                                                    pmb_type_to_be_defined='residue'):
 879            raise ValueError(f"{name} must correspond to a label of a pmb_type='residue' defined on df")
 880        # Copy the data of a residue a `number_of_residues` times in the `df
 881        self.copy_df_entry(name=name,
 882                            column_name='residue_id',
 883                            number_of_copies=number_of_residues)
 884        residues_index = self.np.where(self.df['name']==name)
 885        residue_index_list =list(residues_index[0])[-number_of_residues:]
 886        # Internal bookkepping of the residue info (important for side-chain residues)
 887        # Dict structure {residue_id:{"central_bead_id":central_bead_id, "side_chain_ids":[particle_id1, ...]}}
 888        residues_info={}
 889        for residue_index in residue_index_list:     
 890            self.clean_df_row(index=int(residue_index))
 891            # Assign a residue_id
 892            if self.df['residue_id'].isnull().all():
 893                residue_id=0
 894            else:
 895                residue_id = self.df['residue_id'].max() + 1
 896            self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),index=int (residue_index),new_value=residue_id, warning=False)
 897            # create the principal bead
 898            if self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].central_bead.values[0] is self.np.NaN:
 899                raise ValueError("central_bead must contain a particle name")        
 900            central_bead_name = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].central_bead.values[0]            
 901            central_bead_id = self.create_particle(name=central_bead_name,
 902                                                                espresso_system=espresso_system,
 903                                                                position=central_bead_position,
 904                                                                number_of_particles = 1)[0]
 905            central_bead_position=espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).pos
 906            #assigns same residue_id to the central_bead particle created.
 907            index = self.df[self.df['particle_id']==central_bead_id].index.values[0]
 908            self.df.at [index,'residue_id'] = residue_id
 909            # Internal bookkeeping of the central bead id
 910            residues_info[residue_id]={}
 911            residues_info[residue_id]['central_bead_id']=central_bead_id
 912            # create the lateral beads  
 913            side_chain_list = self.df.loc[self.df.index[residue_index]].side_chains.values[0]
 914            side_chain_beads_ids = []
 915            for side_chain_element in side_chain_list:
 916                if side_chain_element not in self.df.values:              
 917                        raise ValueError (side_chain_element +'is not defined')
 918                pmb_type = self.df[self.df['name']==side_chain_element].pmb_type.values[0] 
 919                if pmb_type == 'particle':
 920                    bond = self.search_bond(particle_name1=central_bead_name, 
 921                                            particle_name2=side_chain_element, 
 922                                            hard_check=True, 
 923                                            use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 924                    l0 = self.get_bond_length(particle_name1=central_bead_name, 
 925                                              particle_name2=side_chain_element, 
 926                                              hard_check=True, 
 927                                              use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 928                    if backbone_vector is None:
 929                        bead_position=self.generate_trialvectors(center=central_bead_position, 
 930                                                                 radius=l0, 
 931                                                                 n_samples=1,
 932                                                                 on_surface=True)[0]
 933                    else:
 934                        bead_position=self.generate_trial_perpendicular_vector(vector=backbone_vector,
 935                                                                            center=central_bead_position, 
 936                                                                            radius=l0)
 937                        
 938                    side_bead_id = self.create_particle(name=side_chain_element, 
 939                                                                    espresso_system=espresso_system,
 940                                                                    position=[bead_position], 
 941                                                                    number_of_particles=1)[0]
 942                    index = self.df[self.df['particle_id']==side_bead_id].index.values[0]
 943                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),
 944                                        index=int (index),
 945                                        new_value=residue_id, 
 946                                        warning=False)
 947                    side_chain_beads_ids.append(side_bead_id)
 948                    espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).add_bond((bond, side_bead_id))
 949                    self.add_bond_in_df(particle_id1=central_bead_id,
 950                                        particle_id2=side_bead_id,
 951                                        use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 952                elif pmb_type == 'residue':
 953                    central_bead_side_chain = self.df[self.df['name']==side_chain_element].central_bead.values[0]
 954                    bond = self.search_bond(particle_name1=central_bead_name, 
 955                                            particle_name2=central_bead_side_chain, 
 956                                            hard_check=True, 
 957                                            use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 958                    l0 = self.get_bond_length(particle_name1=central_bead_name, 
 959                                              particle_name2=central_bead_side_chain, 
 960                                              hard_check=True, 
 961                                              use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 962                    if backbone_vector is None:
 963                        residue_position=self.generate_trialvectors(center=central_bead_position, 
 964                                                                    radius=l0, 
 965                                                                    n_samples=1,
 966                                                                    on_surface=True)[0]
 967                    else:
 968                        residue_position=self.generate_trial_perpendicular_vector(vector=backbone_vector,
 969                                                                                center=central_bead_position, 
 970                                                                                radius=l0)
 971                    lateral_residue_info = self.create_residue(name=side_chain_element, espresso_system=espresso_system,
 972                        number_of_residues=1, central_bead_position=[residue_position],use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 973                    lateral_residue_dict=list(lateral_residue_info.values())[0]
 974                    central_bead_side_chain_id=lateral_residue_dict['central_bead_id']
 975                    lateral_beads_side_chain_ids=lateral_residue_dict['side_chain_ids']
 976                    residue_id_side_chain=list(lateral_residue_info.keys())[0]
 977                    # Change the residue_id of the residue in the side chain to the one of the biger residue
 978                    index = self.df[(self.df['residue_id']==residue_id_side_chain) & (self.df['pmb_type']=='residue') ].index.values[0]
 979                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),
 980                                        index=int(index),
 981                                        new_value=residue_id, 
 982                                        warning=False)
 983                    # Change the residue_id of the particles in the residue in the side chain
 984                    side_chain_beads_ids+=[central_bead_side_chain_id]+lateral_beads_side_chain_ids
 985                    for particle_id in side_chain_beads_ids:
 986                        index = self.df[(self.df['particle_id']==particle_id) & (self.df['pmb_type']=='particle')].index.values[0]
 987                        self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),
 988                                            index=int (index),
 989                                            new_value=residue_id, 
 990                                            warning=False)
 991                    espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).add_bond((bond, central_bead_side_chain_id))
 992                    self.add_bond_in_df(particle_id1=central_bead_id,
 993                                        particle_id2=central_bead_side_chain_id,
 994                                        use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 995            # Internal bookkeeping of the side chain beads ids
 996            residues_info[residue_id]['side_chain_ids']=side_chain_beads_ids
 997        return  residues_info
 998
 999    def create_variable_with_units(self, variable_dict):
1000        """
1001        Returns a pint object with the value and units defined in `variable_dict`.
1002
1003        Args:
1004            variable_dict(`dict`): {'value': value, 'units': units}
1005        Returns:
1006            variable_with_units(`obj`): variable with units using the pyMBE UnitRegistry.
1007        """        
1008        value=variable_dict.pop('value')
1009        units=variable_dict.pop('units')
1010        variable_with_units=value*self.units(units)
1011
1012        return variable_with_units
1013
1014    def define_AA_particles_in_sequence(self, sequence):
1015        '''
1016        Defines in `pmb.df` all the different particles in `sequence`.
1017
1018        Args:
1019            sequence(`lst`):  Sequence of the peptide or protein. 
1020
1021        Note:
1022            - It assumes that the names in `sequence` correspond to amino acid names using the standard one letter code.
1023        '''
1024
1025        already_defined_AA=[]
1026        acidic_aminoacids = ['c','E','D','Y','C']
1027        basic_aminoacids  = ['R','n','K','H']
1028
1029        for residue_name in sequence:
1030            if residue_name in already_defined_AA:
1031                continue
1032            if residue_name in acidic_aminoacids:
1033                self.define_particle (name=residue_name, acidity='acidic')
1034            elif residue_name in basic_aminoacids:
1035                self.define_particle (name=residue_name, acidity='basic')
1036            else:
1037                self.define_particle (name=residue_name, q=0)
1038        return 
1039
1040    def define_AA_residues(self, sequence, model):
1041        """
1042        Defines in `pmb.df` all the different residues in `sequence`.
1043
1044        Args:
1045            sequence(`lst`):  Sequence of the peptide or protein.
1046            model (`string`): Model name. Currently only models with 1 bead '1beadAA' or with 2 beads '2beadAA' per amino acid are supported.
1047
1048        Returns:
1049            residue_list (`list` of `str`): List of the `name`s of the `residue`s  in the sequence of the `molecule`.             
1050        """
1051        residue_list = []
1052        for residue_name in sequence:
1053            if model == '1beadAA':
1054                central_bead = residue_name
1055                side_chains = []
1056            elif model == '2beadAA':
1057                if residue_name in ['c','n', 'G']: 
1058                    central_bead = residue_name
1059                    side_chains = []
1060                else:
1061                    central_bead = 'CA'              
1062                    side_chains = [residue_name]
1063            if residue_name not in residue_list:   
1064                self.define_residue(name = 'AA-'+residue_name, 
1065                                    central_bead = central_bead,
1066                                    side_chains = side_chains)              
1067            residue_list.append('AA-'+residue_name)
1068        return residue_list
1069 
1070    def define_bond(self, bond_object, bond_type, particle_name1, particle_name2):
1071        """
1072        Defines a pmb object of type `bond` in `pymbe.df`
1073        
1074        Args:
1075            bond_object (`cls`): instance of a bond object from espressomd library
1076            bond_type (`str`): label identifying the used bonded potential
1077            particle_name1 (`str`): `name` of the first `particle` to be bonded.
1078            particle_name2 (`str`): `name` of the second `particle` to be bonded.
1079        
1080        Note:
1081            - Currently, only harmonic and FENE bonds are supported.
1082        """    
1083        
1084        valid_bond_types=["harmonic", "FENE"]
1085        if bond_type not in valid_bond_types:
1086                       raise ValueError(f"Bond type {bond_type} currently not implemented in pyMBE, valid types are {valid_bond_types}")
1087
1088        lj_parameters=self.get_lj_parameters(particle_name1=particle_name1, 
1089                                        particle_name2=particle_name2, 
1090                                        combining_rule='Lorentz-Berthelot')
1091
1092        cutoff = 2**(1.0/6.0) * lj_parameters["sigma"]
1093        l0 = self.calculate_initial_bond_length(bond_object=bond_object, 
1094                                                bond_type=bond_type, 
1095                                                epsilon=lj_parameters["epsilon"],
1096                                                sigma=lj_parameters["sigma"],
1097                                                cutoff=cutoff)
1098
1099        index = len(self.df)
1100        for label in [particle_name1+'-'+particle_name2,particle_name2+'-'+particle_name1]:
1101            self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=label, pmb_type_to_be_defined="bond")
1102        self.df.at [index,'name']= particle_name1+'-'+particle_name2
1103        self.df.at [index,'bond_object'] = bond_object
1104        self.df.at [index,'l0'] = l0
1105        self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
1106                                key=('pmb_type',''),
1107                                new_value='bond')
1108        self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
1109                                key=('parameters_of_the_potential',''),
1110                                new_value=self.json.dumps(bond_object.get_params()))
1111        return
1112
1113    def define_default_bond(self, bond_object, bond_type, epsilon=None, sigma=None, cutoff=None):
1114        """
1115        Asigns `bond` in `pmb.df` as the default bond.
1116        The LJ parameters can be optionally provided to calculate the initial bond length
1117
1118        Args:
1119            bond (`obj`): instance of a bond object from the espressomd library.
1120            bond_type (`str`): label identifying the used bonded potential
1121            sigma (`float`, optional): LJ sigma of the interaction between the particles
1122            epsilon (`float`, optional): LJ epsilon for the interaction between the particles
1123            cutoff (`float`, optional): cutoff-radius of the LJ interaction
1124
1125        Note:
1126            - Currently, only harmonic and FENE bonds are supported. 
1127        """
1128        valid_bond_types=["harmonic", "FENE"]
1129        if bond_type not in valid_bond_types:
1130            raise ValueError(f"Bond type {bond_type} currently not implemented in pyMBE, valid types are {valid_bond_types}")
1131        if epsilon is None:
1132            epsilon=1*self.units('reduced_energy')
1133        if sigma is None:
1134            sigma=1*self.units('reduced_length')
1135        if cutoff is None:
1136            cutoff=2**(1.0/6.0)*self.units('reduced_length')
1137        l0 = self.calculate_initial_bond_length(bond_object=bond_object, 
1138                                                bond_type=bond_type, 
1139                                                epsilon=epsilon,
1140                                                sigma=sigma,
1141                                                cutoff=cutoff)
1142
1143        if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name='default',pmb_type_to_be_defined='bond'):
1144            return
1145        if len(self.df.index) != 0:
1146            index = max(self.df.index)+1
1147        else:
1148            index = 0
1149        self.df.at [index,'name'] = 'default'
1150        self.df.at [index,'bond_object'] = bond_object
1151        self.df.at [index,'l0'] = l0
1152        self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
1153                            key=('pmb_type',''),
1154                            new_value='bond')
1155        self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
1156                            key=('parameters_of_the_potential',''),
1157                            new_value=self.json.dumps(bond_object.get_params()))
1158        return
1159
1160    def define_epsilon_value_of_particles(self, eps_dict):
1161        '''
1162        Defines the epsilon value of the particles in `eps_dict` into the `pmb.df`.
1163
1164        Args:
1165            eps_dict(`dict`):  {'name': epsilon}
1166        '''
1167        for residue in eps_dict.keys():
1168            label_list = self.df[self.df['name'] == residue].index.tolist()
1169            for index in label_list:
1170                epsilon = eps_dict[residue]
1171                self.add_value_to_df(key= ('epsilon',''),
1172                        index=int (index),
1173                        new_value=epsilon)
1174        return 
1175
1176    def define_molecule(self, name, residue_list):
1177        """
1178        Defines a pyMBE object of type `molecule` in `pymbe.df`.
1179
1180        Args:
1181            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `molecule`.
1182            residue_list (`list` of `str`): List of the `name`s of the `residue`s  in the sequence of the `molecule`.  
1183        """
1184        if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='molecule'):
1185            return
1186        index = len(self.df)
1187        self.df.at [index,'name'] = name
1188        self.df.at [index,'pmb_type'] = 'molecule'
1189        self.df.at [index,('residue_list','')] = residue_list
1190        return
1191
1192    def define_particle(self, name, q=0, diameter=None, acidity='inert', epsilon=None, pka=None):
1193        """
1194        Defines a pyMBE object of type `particle` in `pymbe.df`
1195
1196        Args:
1197            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `particle`.  
1198            q (`int`, optional): Charge of the `particle`. Defaults to 0.
1199            diameter (`obj`, optional): Diameter used to setup Lennard-Jones interactions for the `particle`, should have units of length using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
1200            epsilon (`obj`, optional): Epsilon parameter used to setup Lennard-Jones interactions for the `particle`, should have units of energy using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry.. Defaults to None
1201            acidity (`str`, optional): Identifies whether if the particle is `acidic` or `basic`, used to setup constant pH simulations. Defaults to `inert`.
1202            pka (`float`, optional): If `particle` is an acid or a base, it defines its  pka-value. Defaults to None.
1203        """ 
1204        if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='particle'):
1205            index = self.df[self.df['name']==name].index[0]                                   
1206        else:
1207            index = len(self.df)
1208            self.df.at [index, 'name'] = name
1209            self.df.at [index,'pmb_type'] = 'particle'
1210            
1211        if diameter:
1212            self.add_value_to_df(key=('diameter',''),index=index,new_value=diameter)
1213        if epsilon:
1214            self.add_value_to_df(key=('epsilon',''),index=index,new_value=epsilon)        
1215        
1216        self.set_particle_acidity ( name=name, acidity = acidity , default_charge=q, pka=pka)
1217        return 
1218    
1219    def define_particles_parameter_from_dict(self, param_dict, param_name):
1220        '''
1221        Defines the `param_name` value of the particles in `param_dict` into the `pmb.df`.
1222
1223        Args:
1224            param_dict(`dict`):  {'name': `param_name` value}
1225        '''
1226        for residue in param_dict.keys():
1227            label_list = self.df[self.df['name'] == residue].index.tolist()
1228            for index in label_list:
1229                value = param_dict[residue]
1230                self.add_value_to_df(key= (param_name,''),
1231                        index=int (index),
1232                        new_value=value)
1233        return 
1234    
1235    def define_peptide(self, name, sequence, model):
1236        """
1237        Defines a pyMBE object of type `peptide` in the `pymbe.df`.
1238
1239        Args:
1240            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `peptide`.
1241            sequence (`string`): Sequence of the `peptide`.
1242            model (`string`): Model name. Currently only models with 1 bead '1beadAA' or with 2 beads '2beadAA' per amino acid are supported.
1243        """
1244        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name = name, pmb_type_to_be_defined='peptide'):
1245            valid_keys = ['1beadAA','2beadAA']
1246            if model not in valid_keys:
1247                raise ValueError('Invalid label for the peptide model, please choose between 1beadAA or 2beadAA')
1248        
1249            clean_sequence = self.protein_sequence_parser(sequence=sequence)    
1250            residue_list = self.define_AA_residues(sequence=clean_sequence,model=model)
1251
1252            self.define_molecule(name = name, residue_list=residue_list)
1253            index = self.df.loc[self.df['name'] == name].index.item() 
1254            self.df.at [index,'model'] = model
1255            self.df.at [index,('sequence','')] = clean_sequence
1256        return
1257    
1258    def define_protein(self, name,model, topology_dict):
1259        """
1260        Defines a pyMBE object of type `protein` in `pymbe.df`.
1261
1262        Args:
1263            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `protein`.
1264            model (`string`): Model name. Currently only models with 1 bead '1beadAA' or with 2 beads '2beadAA' per amino acid are supported.
1265            topology_dict (`dict`): {'initial_pos': coords_list, 'chain_id': id, 'diameter': diameter_value}
1266        """
1267
1268        protein_seq_list = []     
1269    
1270        valid_keys = ['1beadAA','2beadAA']
1271
1272        if model not in valid_keys:
1273            raise ValueError('Invalid label for the peptide model, please choose between 1beadAA or 2beadAA')
1274        
1275        if model == '2beadAA':
1276            self.define_particle(name='CA')
1277
1278        for residue in topology_dict.keys():
1279            residue_name = self.re.split(r'\d+', residue)[0]
1280            if residue_name != 'CA' and residue_name != 'Ca':
1281                protein_seq_list.append(residue_name)                  
1282
1283        protein_sequence = ''.join(protein_seq_list)
1284        clean_sequence = self.protein_sequence_parser(sequence=protein_sequence)
1285
1286        self.define_AA_particles_in_sequence (sequence=clean_sequence)
1287        residue_list = self.define_AA_residues(sequence=clean_sequence, model=model)
1288
1289        index = len(self.df)
1290        self.df.at [index,'name'] = name
1291        self.df.at [index,'pmb_type'] = 'protein'
1292        self.df.at [index,'model'] = model
1293        self.df.at [index,('sequence','')] = clean_sequence  
1294        self.df.at [index,('residue_list','')] = residue_list    
1295
1296        return 
1297    
1298    def define_residue(self, name, central_bead, side_chains):
1299        """
1300        Defines a pyMBE object of type `residue` in `pymbe.df`.
1301
1302        Args:
1303            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `residue`.
1304            central_bead (`str`): `name` of the `particle` to be placed as central_bead of the `residue`.
1305            side_chains (`list` of `str`): List of `name`s of the pmb_objects to be placed as side_chains of the `residue`. Currently, only pmb_objects of type `particle`s or `residue`s are supported.
1306        """
1307        if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='residue'):
1308            return
1309        index = len(self.df)
1310        self.df.at [index, 'name'] = name
1311        self.df.at [index,'pmb_type'] = 'residue'
1312        self.df.at [index,'central_bead'] = central_bead
1313        self.df.at [index,('side_chains','')] = side_chains
1314        return 
1315
1316    def destroy_pmb_object_in_system(self, name, espresso_system):
1317        """
1318        Destroys all particles associated with `name` in `espresso_system` amd removes the destroyed pmb_objects from `pmb.df` 
1319
1320        Args:
1321            name (str): Label of the pmb object to be destroyed. The pmb object must be defined in `pymbe.df`.
1322            espresso_system (cls): Instance of a system class from espressomd library.
1323
1324        Note:
1325            - If `name`  is a object_type=`particle`, only the matching particles that are not part of bigger objects (e.g. `residue`, `molecule`) will be destroyed. To destroy particles in such objects, destroy the bigger object instead.
1326        """
1327        allowed_objects = ['particle','residue','molecule']
1328        pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]
1329        if pmb_type not in allowed_objects:
1330            raise ValueError('Object type not supported, supported types are ', allowed_objects)
1331        if pmb_type == 'particle':
1332            particles_index = self.df.index[(self.df['name'] == name) & (self.df['residue_id'].isna()) 
1333                                                  & (self.df['molecule_id'].isna())]
1334            particle_ids_list= self.df.loc[(self.df['name'] == name) & (self.df['residue_id'].isna())
1335                                                 & (self.df['molecule_id'].isna())].particle_id.tolist()
1336            for particle_id in particle_ids_list:
1337                espresso_system.part.by_id(particle_id).remove()
1338            self.df = self.df.drop(index=particles_index)
1339        if pmb_type == 'residue':
1340            residues_id = self.df.loc[self.df['name']== name].residue_id.to_list()
1341            for residue_id in residues_id:
1342                particle_ids_list = self.df.loc[self.df['residue_id']==residue_id].particle_id.dropna().to_list()
1343                self.df = self.df.drop(self.df[self.df['residue_id'] == residue_id].index)
1344                for particle_id in particle_ids_list:
1345                    espresso_system.part.by_id(particle_id).remove()
1346                    self.df= self.df.drop(self.df[self.df['particle_id']==particle_id].index)    
1347        if pmb_type == 'molecule':
