  16    import pandas as pd 
  17    import json
  18    from scipy import optimize
  19    units = pint.UnitRegistry()
  20    N_A=6.02214076e23    / units.mol
  21    Kb=1.38064852e-23    * units.J / units.K
  22    e=1.60217662e-19 *units.C
  23    df=None
  24    kT=None
  25
  26    def __init__(self, temperature=None, unit_length=None, unit_charge=None):
  27        """
  28        Initializes the pymbe_library by setting up the reduced unit system with `temperature` and `reduced_length` 
  29        and sets up  the `pmb.df` for bookkeeping.
  30
  31        Args:
  32            temperature(`obj`,optional): Value of the temperature in the pyMBE UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
  33            unit_length(`obj`, optional): Value of the unit of length in the pyMBE UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
  34            unit_charge (`obj`,optional): Reduced unit of charge defined using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. Defaults to None. 
  35        
  36        Note:
  37            - If no `temperature` is given, a value of 298.15 K is assumed by default.
  38            - If no `unit_length` is given, a value of 0.355 nm is assumed by default.
  39            - If no `unit_charge` is given, a value of 1 elementary charge is assumed by default. 
  40        """
  41        # Default definitions of reduced units
  42        if temperature is None:
  43            temperature= 298.15 * self.units.K
  44        if unit_length is None:
  45            unit_length= 0.355 * self.units.nm
  46        if unit_charge is None:
  47            unit_charge=self.units.e
  48        self.kT=temperature*self.Kb
  49        self.units.define(f'reduced_energy = {self.kT}')
  50        self.units.define(f'reduced_length = {unit_length}')
  51        self.units.define(f'reduced_charge = 1*e')
  52        self.setup_df()
  53        return
  54    
  55    def activate_motion_of_rigid_object(self, name, espresso_system):
  56        '''
  57        Activates the motion of the rigid object `name` in the `espresso_system`.
  58
  59        Args:
  60            name(`str`): Label of the object.
  61            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
  62
  63        Note:
  64            - It requires that espressomd has the following features activated: ["VIRTUAL_SITES_RELATIVE", "MASS"].
  65        '''
  66        print ('activate_motion_of_rigid_object requires that espressomd has the following features activated: ["VIRTUAL_SITES_RELATIVE", "MASS"]')
  67        pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]
  68        if pmb_type != 'protein':
  69            raise ValueError (f'The pmb_type: {pmb_type} is not currently supported. The supported pmb_type is: protein')
  70        molecule_ids_list = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].molecule_id.to_list()
  71        for molecule_id in molecule_ids_list:    
  72            particle_ids_list = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].particle_id.dropna().to_list()
  73            center_of_mass = self.calculate_center_of_mass_of_molecule ( molecule_id=molecule_id,espresso_system=espresso_system)
  74            rigid_object_center = espresso_system.part.add(pos=center_of_mass,
  75                                                           rotation=[True,True,True], 
  76                                                           type=self.propose_unused_type())
  77            for particle_id in particle_ids_list:
  78                pid = espresso_system.part.by_id(particle_id)
  79                pid.vs_auto_relate_to(rigid_object_center.id)
  80        return
  81
  82    def add_bond_in_df(self, particle_id1, particle_id2, use_default_bond=False):
  83        """
  84        Adds a bond entry on the `pymbe.df` storing the particle_ids of the two bonded particles.
  85
  86        Args:
  87            particle_id1 (`int`): particle_id of the type of the first particle type of the bonded particles
  88            particle_id2 (`int`): particle_id of the type of the second particle type of the bonded particles
  89            use_default_bond (`bool`, optional): Controls if a bond of type `default` is used to bond particle whose bond types are not defined in `pmb.df`. Defaults to False.
  90        """
  91        particle_name1 = self.df.loc[self.df['particle_id']==particle_id1].name.values[0]
  92        particle_name2 = self.df.loc[self.df['particle_id']==particle_id2].name.values[0]
  93        bond_key = self.find_bond_key(particle_name1=particle_name1,
  94                                    particle_name2=particle_name2, 
  95                                    use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
  96        if not bond_key:
  97            return
  98        self.copy_df_entry(name=bond_key,column_name='particle_id2',number_of_copies=1)
  99        indexs = self.np.where(self.df['name']==bond_key)
 100        index_list = list (indexs[0])
 101        used_bond_df = self.df.loc[self.df['particle_id2'].notnull()]
 102        #without this drop the program crashes when dropping duplicates because the 'bond' column is a dict
 103        used_bond_df = used_bond_df.drop([('bond_object','')],axis =1 )
 104        if len(used_bond_df.index) > 1: 
 105            used_bond_df = used_bond_df.drop_duplicates(keep='first')
 106        used_bond_index = used_bond_df.index.to_list()
 107        for index in index_list:
 108            if index not in used_bond_index:
 109                self.clean_df_row(index=int(index))
 110                self.df.at[index,'particle_id'] = particle_id1
 111                self.df.at[index,'particle_id2'] = particle_id2
 112                break
 113        return
 114
 115    def add_bonds_to_espresso(self, espresso_system) :
 116        """
 117        Adds all bonds defined in `pmb.df` to `espresso_system`.
 118
 119        Args:
 120            espresso_system (str): system object of espressomd library
 121        """
 122
 123        if 'bond' in self.df.values:
 124            bond_df = self.df.loc[self.df ['pmb_type'] == 'bond']
 125            bond_list = bond_df.bond_object.values.tolist()
 126            for bond in bond_list:
 127                espresso_system.bonded_inter.add(bond)
 128        else:
 129            print ('WARNING: There are no bonds defined in pymbe.df')
 130        
 131        return
 132
 133    def add_value_to_df(self,index,key,new_value, warning=True):
 134        """
 135        Adds a value to a cell in the `pmb.df` DataFrame.
 136
 137        Args:
 138            index(`int`): index of the row to add the value to.
 139            key(`str`): the column label to add the value to.
 140            warning(`bool`, optional): If true, prints a warning if a value is being overwritten in `pmb.df`. Defaults to true.
 141        """
 142        # Make sure index is a scalar integer value
 143        index = int (index)
 144        assert isinstance(index, int), '`index` should be a scalar integer value.'
 145        idx = self.pd.IndexSlice
 146        if self.check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(index=index,key=key):
 147            old_value= self.df.loc[index,idx[key]]
 148            if warning:
 149                if old_value != new_value:
 150                    name=self.df.loc[index,('name','')]
 151                    pmb_type=self.df.loc[index,('pmb_type','')]
 152                    print(f"WARNING: you are redefining the properties of {name} of pmb_type {pmb_type}")
 153                    print(f'WARNING: overwritting the value of the entry `{key}`: old_value = {old_value} new_value = {new_value}')
 154        self.df.loc[index,idx[key]] = new_value
 155        return
 156    
 157    def assign_molecule_id(self, name, molecule_index, pmb_type, used_molecules_id):
 158        """
 159        Assigns the `molecule_id` of the pmb object given by `pmb_type`
 160        
 161        Args:
 162            name(`str`): Label of the molecule type to be created. `name` must be defined in `pmb.df`
 163            pmb_type(`str`): pmb_object_type to assign the `molecule_id` 
 164            molecule_index (`int`): index of the current `pmb_object_type` to assign the `molecule_id`
 165            used_molecules_id (`lst`): list with the `molecule_id` values already used.
 166        
 167        Returns:
 168            molecule_id(`int`): Id of the molecule
 169        """
 170
 171        self.clean_df_row(index=int(molecule_index))
 172        
 173        if self.df['molecule_id'].isnull().values.all():
 174            molecule_id = 0        
 175        else:
 176            # check if a residue is part of another molecule
 177            check_residue_name = self.df[self.df['residue_list'].astype(str).str.contains(name)]
 178            pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]                
 179            if not check_residue_name.empty and pmb_type == pmb_type :              
 180                for value in check_residue_name.index.to_list():                  
 181                    if value not in used_molecules_id:                              
 182                        molecule_id = self.df.loc[value].molecule_id.values[0]                    
 183                        break
 184            else:
 185                molecule_id = self.df['molecule_id'].max() +1
 186
 187        self.add_value_to_df (key=('molecule_id',''),
 188                                index=int(molecule_index),
 189                                new_value=molecule_id, 
 190                                warning=False)
 191
 192        return molecule_id
 193    
 194    def calculate_center_of_mass_of_molecule(self, molecule_id, espresso_system):
 195        """
 196        Calculates the center of mass of type `name`.
 197
 198        Args:
 199            molecule_id(`int`): Id of the molecule to be centered.
 200            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
 201        
 202        Returns:
 203            center_of_mass(`lst`): Coordinates of the center of mass.
 204        """
 205        total_beads = 0
 206        center_of_mass = self.np.zeros(3)
 207        axis_list = [0,1,2]
 208        particle_id_list = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].particle_id.dropna().to_list()
 209        for pid in particle_id_list:
 210            total_beads +=1 
 211            for axis in axis_list:
 212                center_of_mass [axis] += espresso_system.part.by_id(pid).pos[axis]
 213        center_of_mass = center_of_mass /total_beads  
 214        return center_of_mass
 215
 216    def calculate_HH(self, object_name, pH_list=None, pka_set=None):
 217        """
 218        Calculates the charge per molecule according to the ideal Henderson-Hasselbalch titration curve 
 219        for molecules with the name `object_name`.
 220
 221        Args:
 222            object_name (`str`): name of the molecule to calculate the ideal charge for
 223            pH_list(`lst`): pH-values to calculate. 
 224            pka_set(`dict`): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}
 225
 226        Returns:
 227            Z_HH (`lst`): Henderson-Hasselbalch prediction of the charge of `sequence` in `pH_list`
 228
 229        Note:
 230            - This function supports objects with pmb types: "molecule", "peptide" and "protein".
 231            - If no `pH_list` is given, 50 equispaced pH-values ranging from 2 to 12 are calculated
 232            - If no `pka_set` is given, the pKa values are taken from `pmb.df`
 233            - This function should only be used for single-phase systems. For two-phase systems `calculate_HH_Donnan` has to be used.
 234        """
 235        if pH_list is None:
 236            pH_list=self.np.linspace(2,12,50)    
 237        if pka_set is None:
 238            pka_set=self.get_pka_set() 
 239        self.check_pka_set(pka_set=pka_set)
 240        charge_map = self.get_charge_map()
 241        Z_HH=[]
 242        for pH_value in pH_list:    
 243            Z=0
 244            index = self.df.loc[self.df['name'] == object_name].index[0].item() 
 245            residue_list = self.df.at [index,('residue_list','')]
 246            sequence = self.df.at [index,('sequence','')]
 247            if self.np.any(self.pd.isnull(sequence)):
 248                # Molecule has no sequence
 249                for residue in residue_list:
 250                    list_of_particles_in_residue = self.search_particles_in_residue(residue)
 251                    for particle in list_of_particles_in_residue:
 252                        if particle in pka_set.keys():
 253                            if pka_set[particle]['acidity'] == 'acidic':
 254                                psi=-1
 255                            elif pka_set[particle]['acidity']== 'basic':
 256                                psi=+1
 257                            else:
 258                                psi=0
 259                            Z+=psi/(1+10**(psi*(pH_value-pka_set[particle]['pka_value'])))                      
 260                Z_HH.append(Z)
 261            else:
 262                # Molecule has a sequence
 263                if not isinstance(sequence, list):
 264                    # If the df has been read by file, the sequence needs to be parsed.
 265                    sequence = self.parse_sequence_from_file(sequence=sequence)
 266                for name in sequence:
 267                    if name in pka_set.keys():
 268                        if pka_set[name]['acidity'] == 'acidic':
 269                            psi=-1
 270                        elif pka_set[name]['acidity']== 'basic':
 271                            psi=+1
 272                        else:
 273                            psi=0
 274                        Z+=psi/(1+10**(psi*(pH_value-pka_set[name]['pka_value'])))
 275                    else:
 276                        state_one_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_one.es_type.values[0]
 277                        Z+=charge_map[state_one_type]
 278                Z_HH.append(Z)
 279
 280        return Z_HH
 281
 282    def calculate_HH_Donnan(self, espresso_system, object_names, c_salt, pH_list=None, pka_set=None):
 283        """
 284        Calculates the charge on the different molecules according to the Henderson-Hasselbalch equation coupled to the Donnan partitioning.
 285
 286        Args:
 287            object_names ('lst'): List of the object names of all (potentially) charged molecules in the system.
 288            c_salt ('float'): Salt concentration in the reservoir.
 289            pH_list ('lst'): List of pH-values in the reservoir. 
 290            pka_set ('dict'): {"name": {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}.
 291
 292        Returns:
 293            {"charges_dict": {"name": charges}, "pH_system_list": pH_system_list, "partition_coefficients": partition_coefficients_list}
 294            pH_system_list ('lst'): List of pH_values in the system.
 295            partition_coefficients_list ('lst'): List of partition coefficients of cations.
 296
 297        Note:
 298            - If no `pH_list` is given, 50 equispaced pH-values ranging from 2 to 12 are calculated
 299            - If no `pka_set` is given, the pKa values are taken from `pmb.df`
 300            - If `object_names` does not contain the object names of all (potentially) charged molecules in the system, the calculation will give a wrong result.
 301        """
 302        if pH_list is None:
 303            pH_list=self.np.linspace(2,12,50)    
 304        if pka_set is None:
 305            pka_set=self.get_pka_set() 
 306        self.check_pka_set(pka_set=pka_set)
 307
 308        partition_coefficients_list = []
 309        pH_system_list = []
 310        Z_HH_Donnan={}
 311        concentrations_molecules={}
 312        for key in object_names:
 313            Z_HH_Donnan[key] = []
 314            # Calculate the concentrations of the different types of molecules
 315            concentrations_molecules[key] = (len(self.df.loc[self.df['name'] == key].index) / (self.N_A * self.units.Quantity(espresso_system.volume(), 'reduced_length**3'))).to('mol/liter')
 316
 317        def calc_charges(object_names, pH):
 318            """
 319            Calculates the charges of the different kinds of molecules according to the Henderson-Hasselbalch equation.
 320
 321            Args:
 322                object_names ('lst'): List of the object names of all (potentially) charged molecules in the system.
 323                pH ('float'): pH-value that is used in the HH equation.
 324
 325            Returns:
 326                charge ('dict'): {"molecule_name": charge}
 327            """
 328            charge = {}
 329            for name in object_names:
 330                charge[name] = self.calculate_HH(name, [pH], pka_set)[0]
 331            return charge
 332
 333        def calc_partition_coefficient(charge, concentrations_molecules):
 334            """
 335            Calculates the partition coefficients of positive ions according to the ideal Donnan theory.
 336
 337            Args:
 338                charge ('dict'): {"molecule_name": charge}
 339                concentrations_molecules ('dict'): {"molecule_name": concentration}.
 340            """
 341            nonlocal ionic_strength_res
 342            charge_density = 0.0
 343            for key in charge:
 344                charge_density += charge[key] * concentrations_molecules[key]
 345            return (-charge_density / (2 * ionic_strength_res) + self.np.sqrt((charge_density / (2 * ionic_strength_res))**2 + 1)).magnitude
 346
 347        for pH_value in pH_list:    
 348            # calculate the ionic strength of the reservoir
 349            if pH_value <= 7.0:
 350                ionic_strength_res = 10 ** (-pH_value) * self.units.mol/self.units.l + c_salt 
 351            elif pH_value > 7.0:
 352                ionic_strength_res = 10 ** (-(14-pH_value)) * self.units.mol/self.units.l + c_salt
 353
 354            #Determine the partition coefficient of positive ions by solving the system of nonlinear, coupled equations
 355            #consisting of the partition coefficient given by the ideal Donnan theory and the Henderson-Hasselbalch equation.
 356            #The nonlinear equation is formulated for log(xi) since log-operations are not supported for RootResult objects.
 357            equation = lambda logxi: logxi - self.np.log10(calc_partition_coefficient(calc_charges(object_names, pH_value - logxi), concentrations_molecules))
 358            logxi = self.optimize.root_scalar(equation, bracket=[-1e2, 1e2], method="brentq")
 359            partition_coefficient = 10**logxi.root
 360
 361            charges_temp = calc_charges(object_names, pH_value-self.np.log10(partition_coefficient))
 362            for key in object_names:
 363                Z_HH_Donnan[key].append(charges_temp[key])
 364
 365            pH_system_list.append(pH_value - self.np.log10(partition_coefficient))
 366            partition_coefficients_list.append(partition_coefficient)
 367
 368        return {"charges_dict": Z_HH_Donnan, "pH_system_list": pH_system_list, "partition_coefficients": partition_coefficients_list}
 369
 370    def calculate_initial_bond_length(self, bond_object, bond_type, epsilon, sigma, cutoff):
 371        """
 372        Calculates the initial bond length that is used when setting up molecules,
 373        based on the minimum of the sum of bonded and short-range (LJ) interactions.
 374        
 375        Args:
 376            bond_object (`cls`): instance of a bond object from espressomd library
 377            bond_type (`str`): label identifying the used bonded potential
 378            epsilon (`float`): LJ epsilon of the interaction between the particles
 379            sigma (`float`): LJ sigma of the interaction between the particles
 380            cutoff (`float`): cutoff-radius of the LJ interaction 
 381        """    
 382        def truncated_lj_potential(x, epsilon, sigma, cutoff):
 383            if x>cutoff:
 384                return 0.0
 385            else:
 386                return 4*epsilon*((sigma/x)**12-(sigma/x)**6) - 4*epsilon*((sigma/cutoff)**12-(sigma/cutoff)**6)
 387
 388        epsilon_red=epsilon.to('reduced_energy').magnitude
 389        sigma_red=sigma.to('reduced_length').magnitude
 390        cutoff_red=cutoff.to('reduced_length').magnitude
 391
 392        if bond_type == "harmonic":
 393               r_0 = bond_object.params.get('r_0')
 394               k = bond_object.params.get('k')
 395               l0 = self.optimize.minimize(lambda x: 0.5*k*(x-r_0)**2 + truncated_lj_potential(x, epsilon_red, sigma_red, cutoff_red), x0=r_0).x
 396        elif bond_type == "FENE":
 397               r_0 = bond_object.params.get('r_0')
 398               k = bond_object.params.get('k')
 399               d_r_max = bond_object.params.get('d_r_max')
 400               l0 = self.optimize.minimize(lambda x: -0.5*k*(d_r_max**2)*self.np.log(1-((x-r_0)/d_r_max)**2) + truncated_lj_potential(x, epsilon_red, sigma_red, cutoff_red), x0=1.0).x
 401        return l0
 402
 403    def calculate_net_charge (self, espresso_system, molecule_name):
 404        '''
 405        Calculates the net charge per molecule of molecules with `name` = object_name. 
 406        Returns the net charge per molecule and a maps with the net charge per residue and molecule.
 407
 408        Args:
 409            espresso_system: system information 
 410            object_name (str): name of the molecule to calculate the net charge
 411
 412        Returns:
 413            {"mean": mean_net_charge, "molecules": {mol_id: net_charge_of_mol_id, }, "residues": {res_id: net_charge_of_res_id, }}
 414
 415        Note:
 416            - The net charge of the molecule is averaged over all molecules of type `name` 
 417            - The net charge of each particle type is averaged over all particle of the same type in all molecules of type `name`
 418        '''        
 419        valid_pmb_types = ["molecule", "protein"]
 420        pmb_type=self.df.loc[self.df['name']==molecule_name].pmb_type.values[0]
 421        if pmb_type not in valid_pmb_types:
 422            raise ValueError("The pyMBE object with name {object_name} has a pmb_type {pmb_type}. This function only supports pyMBE types {valid_pmb_types}")      
 423        charge_in_residues = {}
 424        id_map = self.get_particle_id_map(object_name=molecule_name)
 425        def create_charge_map(espresso_system,id_map,label):
 426            charge_map={}
 427            for super_id in id_map[label].keys():
 428                net_charge=0
 429                for pid in id_map[label][super_id]:
 430                    net_charge+=espresso_system.part.by_id(pid).q
 431                charge_map[super_id]=net_charge
 432            return charge_map
 433        net_charge_molecules=create_charge_map(label="molecule_map",
 434                                                espresso_system=espresso_system,
 435                                                id_map=id_map)
 436        net_charge_residues=create_charge_map(label="residue_map",
 437                                                espresso_system=espresso_system,
 438                                                id_map=id_map)       
 439        mean_charge=self.np.mean(self.np.array(list(net_charge_molecules.values())))
 440        return {"mean": mean_charge, "molecules": net_charge_molecules, "residues": net_charge_residues}
 441
 442    def center_molecule_in_simulation_box(self, molecule_id, espresso_system):
 443        """
 444        Centers the pmb object matching `molecule_id` in the center of the simulation box in `espresso_md`.
 445        
 446        Args:
 447            molecule_id(`int`): Id of the molecule to be centered.
 448            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
 449        """
 450        center_of_mass = self.calculate_center_of_mass_of_molecule ( molecule_id=molecule_id,espresso_system=espresso_system)
 451        box_center = [espresso_system.box_l[0]/2.0]*3
 452        pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].pmb_type.values[0]
 453        pmb_objects = ['protein','molecule','peptide']
 454        if pmb_type in pmb_objects:
 455            particle_id_list = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].particle_id.dropna().to_list()
 456            for pid in particle_id_list:
 457                es_pos = espresso_system.part.by_id(pid).pos
 458                espresso_system.part.by_id(pid).pos = es_pos - center_of_mass + box_center
 459        return 
 460
 461    def check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(self, index,key):
 462        """
 463        Checks if a cell in the `pmb.df` at the specified index and column has a value.
 464
 465        Args:
 466            index(`int`): Index of the row to check.
 467            key(`str`): Column label to check.
 468
 469        Returns:
 470            `bool`: `True` if the cell has a value, `False` otherwise.
 471        """
 472        idx = self.pd.IndexSlice
 473        return not self.pd.isna(self.df.loc[index, idx[key]])
 474
 475    def check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(self, name, pmb_type_to_be_defined):
 476        """
 477        Checks if `name` is defined in `pmb.df`.
 478
 479        Args:
 480            name(`str`): label to check if defined in `pmb.df`.
 481            pmb_type_to_be_defined(`str`): pmb object type corresponding to `name`.
 482
 483        Returns:
 484            `bool`: `True` for success, `False` otherwise.
 485        """
 486        if name in self.df['name'].unique():
 487            current_object_type = self.df[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]
 488            if current_object_type != pmb_type_to_be_defined:
 489                raise ValueError ((f"The name {name} is already defined in the df with a pmb_type = {current_object_type}, pymMBE does not support objects with the same name but different pmb_types"))    
 490            return True            
 491        else:
 492            return False
 493
 494    def check_pka_set(self, pka_set):
 495        """
 496        Checks that `pka_set` has the formatting expected by the pyMBE library.
 497       
 498        Args:
 499            pka_set (dict): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}
 500        """
 501        required_keys=['pka_value','acidity']
 502        for required_key in required_keys:
 503            for pka_entry in pka_set.values():
 504                if required_key not in pka_entry.keys():
 505                    raise ValueError('missing a requiered key ', required_keys, 'in the following entry of pka_set', pka_entry)
 506        return
 507
 508    def clean_df_row(self, index, columns_keys_to_clean=["particle_id", "particle_id2", "residue_id", "molecule_id"]):
 509        """
 510        Cleans the columns of `pmb.df` in `columns_keys_to_clean` of the row with index `index` by assigning them a np.nan value.
 511
 512        Args:
 513            index(`int`): Index of the row to clean.
 514            columns_keys_to_clean(`list` of `str`, optional): List with the column keys to be cleaned. Defaults to [`particle_id`, `particle_id2`, `residue_id`, `molecule_id`].
 515        """   
 516        for column_key in columns_keys_to_clean:
 517            self.add_value_to_df(key=(column_key,''),index=index,new_value=self.np.nan, warning=False)
 518        return
 519
 520    def copy_df_entry(self, name, column_name, number_of_copies):
 521        '''
 522        Creates 'number_of_copies' of a given 'name' in `pymbe.df`.
 523
 524        Args:
 525            name(`str`): Label of the particle/residue/molecule type to be created. `name` must be defined in `pmb.df`
 526            column_name(`str`): Column name to use as a filter. 
 527            number_of_copies(`int`): number of copies of `name` to be created.
 528        
 529        Note:
 530            - Currently, column_name only supports "particle_id", "particle_id2", "residue_id" and "molecule_id" 
 531        '''
 532
 533        valid_column_names=["particle_id", "residue_id", "molecule_id", "particle_id2" ]
 534        if column_name not in valid_column_names:
 535            raise ValueError(f"{column_name} is not a valid column_name, currently only the following are supported: {valid_column_names}")
 536        df_by_name = self.df.loc[self.df.name == name]
 537        if number_of_copies != 1:           
 538            if df_by_name[column_name].isnull().values.any():       
 539                    df_by_name_repeated = self.pd.concat ([df_by_name]*(number_of_copies-1), ignore_index=True)
 540            else:
 541                df_by_name = df_by_name[df_by_name.index == df_by_name.index.min()] 
 542                df_by_name_repeated = self.pd.concat ([df_by_name]*(number_of_copies), ignore_index=True)
 543                df_by_name_repeated[column_name] =self.np.NaN
 544            # Concatenate the new particle rows to  `df`
 545            self.df = self.pd.concat ([self.df,df_by_name_repeated], ignore_index=True)
 546        else:
 547            if not df_by_name[column_name].isnull().values.any():     
 548                df_by_name = df_by_name[df_by_name.index == df_by_name.index.min()] 
 549                df_by_name_repeated = self.pd.concat ([df_by_name]*(number_of_copies), ignore_index=True)
 550                df_by_name_repeated[column_name] =self.np.NaN
 551                self.df = self.pd.concat ([self.df,df_by_name_repeated], ignore_index=True)        
 552        return
 553
 554    def create_added_salt (self, espresso_system, cation_name, anion_name, c_salt):    
 555        """
 556        Creates a `c_salt` concentration of `cation_name` and `anion_name` ions into the `espresso_system`.
 557
 558        Args:
 559            espresso_system (`obj`): instance of an espresso system object.
 560            cation_name(`str`): `name` of a particle with a positive charge.
 561            anion_name(`str`): `name` of a particle with a negative charge.
 562            c_salt (float): Salt concentration. 
 563            
 564        Returns:
 565            c_salt_calculated (float): Calculated salt concentration added to `espresso_system`.
 566        """
 567        cation_name_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==cation_name].state_one.charge.values[0]
 568        anion_name_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==anion_name].state_one.charge.values[0]     
 569        if cation_name_charge <= 0:
 570            raise ValueError('ERROR cation charge must be positive, charge ',cation_name_charge)
 571        if anion_name_charge >= 0:
 572            raise ValueError('ERROR anion charge must be negative, charge ', anion_name_charge)
 573        # Calculate the number of ions in the simulation box
 574        volume=self.units.Quantity(espresso_system.volume(), 'reduced_length**3')
 575        if c_salt.check('[substance] [length]**-3'):
 576            N_ions= int((volume*c_salt.to('mol/reduced_length**3')*self.N_A).magnitude)
 577            c_salt_calculated=N_ions/(volume*self.N_A)
 578        elif c_salt.check('[length]**-3'):
 579            N_ions= int((volume*c_salt.to('reduced_length**-3')*self.N_A).magnitude)
 580            c_salt_calculated=N_ions/volume
 581        else:
 582            raise ValueError('Unknown units for c_salt, please provided it in [mol / volume] or [particle / volume]', c_salt)
 583        N_cation = N_ions*abs(anion_name_charge)
 584        N_anion = N_ions*abs(cation_name_charge)
 585        self.create_particle(espresso_system=espresso_system, name=cation_name, number_of_particles=N_cation)
 586        self.create_particle(espresso_system=espresso_system, name=anion_name, number_of_particles=N_anion)
 587        print('\n Added salt concentration of ', c_salt_calculated.to('mol/L'), 'given by ', N_cation, ' cations and ', N_anion, ' anions')
 588        return c_salt_calculated
 589
 590    def create_counterions(self, object_name, cation_name, anion_name, espresso_system):
 591        """
 592        Creates particles of `cation_name` and `anion_name` in `espresso_system` to counter the net charge of `pmb_object`.
 593        
 594        Args:
 595            object_name(`str`): `name` of a pymbe object.
 596            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
 597            cation_name(`str`): `name` of a particle with a positive charge.
 598            anion_name(`str`): `name` of a particle with a negative charge.
 599
 600        Returns: 
 601            counterion_number (dict): {"name": number}
 602        """
 603        cation_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==cation_name].state_one.charge.iloc[0]
 604        anion_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==anion_name].state_one.charge.iloc[0]
 605        object_ids = self.get_particle_id_map(object_name=object_name)["all"]
 606        counterion_number={}
 607        object_charge={}
 608        for name in ['positive', 'negative']:
 609            object_charge[name]=0
 610        for id in object_ids:
 611            if espresso_system.part.by_id(id).q > 0:
 612                object_charge['positive']+=1*(self.np.abs(espresso_system.part.by_id(id).q ))
 613            elif espresso_system.part.by_id(id).q < 0:
 614                object_charge['negative']+=1*(self.np.abs(espresso_system.part.by_id(id).q ))
 615        if (object_charge['positive'] % abs(anion_charge) == 0):
 616            counterion_number[anion_name]=int(object_charge['positive']/abs(anion_charge))
 617        else:
 618            raise ValueError('The number of positive charges in the pmb_object must be divisible by the  charge of the anion')
 619        if (object_charge['negative'] % abs(cation_charge) == 0):
 620            counterion_number[cation_name]=int(object_charge['negative']/cation_charge)
 621        else:
 622            raise ValueError('The number of negative charges in the pmb_object must be divisible by the  charge of the cation')
 623        if counterion_number[cation_name] > 0: 
 624            self.create_particle(espresso_system=espresso_system, name=cation_name, number_of_particles=counterion_number[cation_name])
 625        else:
 626            counterion_number[cation_name]=0
 627        if counterion_number[anion_name] > 0:
 628            self.create_particle(espresso_system=espresso_system, name=anion_name, number_of_particles=counterion_number[anion_name])
 629        else:
 630            counterion_number[anion_name] = 0
 631        print('The following counter-ions have been created: ')
 632        for name in counterion_number.keys():
 633            print(f'Ion type: {name} created number: {counterion_number[name]}')
 634        return counterion_number
 635
 636    def create_molecule(self, name, number_of_molecules, espresso_system, first_residue_position=None, use_default_bond=False):
 637        """
 638        Creates `number_of_molecules` molecule of type `name` into `espresso_system` and bookkeeps them into `pmb.df`.
 639
 640        Args:
 641            name(`str`): Label of the molecule type to be created. `name` must be defined in `pmb.df`
 642            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from espressomd library.
 643            number_of_molecules(`int`): Number of molecules of type `name` to be created.
 644            first_residue_position(`list`, optional): coordinates where the first_residue_position will be created, random by default
 645            use_default_bond(`bool`, optional): Controls if a bond of type `default` is used to bond particle with undefined bonds in `pymbe.df`
 646        Returns:
 647            molecules_info (`dict`):  {molecule_id: {residue_id:{"central_bead_id":central_bead_id, "side_chain_ids": [particle_id1, ...]}}} 
 648        """
 649        if number_of_molecules <= 0:
 650            return
 651        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,
 652                                                    pmb_type_to_be_defined='molecule'):
 653            raise ValueError(f"{name} must correspond to a label of a pmb_type='molecule' defined on df")
 654        first_residue = True
 655        molecule_info = []
 656        residue_list = self.df[self.df['name']==name].residue_list.values [0]
 657
 658        self.copy_df_entry(name=name,
 659                        column_name='molecule_id',
 660                        number_of_copies=number_of_molecules)
 661        
 662        molecules_index = self.np.where(self.df['name']==name)
 663        molecule_index_list =list(molecules_index[0])[-number_of_molecules:]
 664        used_molecules_id = self.df.molecule_id.dropna().drop_duplicates().tolist()
 665
 666        for molecule_index in molecule_index_list:         
 667
 668            molecule_id = self.assign_molecule_id (name=name,pmb_type='molecule',used_molecules_id=used_molecules_id,molecule_index=molecule_index)
 669
 670            for residue in residue_list:
 671                if first_residue:
 672                    residue_position = first_residue_position
 673                    backbone_vector = self.generate_trialvectors(center=[0,0,0], 
 674                                                                 radius=1, 
 675                                                                 n_samples=1,
 676                                                                 on_surface=True)[0]
 677                    residues_info = self.create_residue(name=residue,
 678                                                                    number_of_residues=1, 
 679                                                                    espresso_system=espresso_system, 
 680                                                                    central_bead_position=first_residue_position,  
 681                                                                    use_default_bond= use_default_bond, 
 682                                                                    backbone_vector=backbone_vector)
 683                    residue_id = next(iter(residues_info))
 684                    for index in self.df[self.df['residue_id']==residue_id].index:
 685                        self.add_value_to_df(key=('molecule_id',''),
 686                                            index=int (index),
 687                                            new_value=molecule_id)
 688                    central_bead_id = residues_info[residue_id]['central_bead_id']
 689                    previous_residue = residue
 690                    residue_position = espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).pos
 691                    previous_residue_id = central_bead_id
 692                    first_residue = False          
 693                else:                    
 694                    previous_central_bead_name=self.df[self.df['name']==previous_residue].central_bead.values[0]
 695                    new_central_bead_name=self.df[self.df['name']==residue].central_bead.values[0]       
 696                    bond = self.search_bond(particle_name1=previous_central_bead_name, 
 697                                            particle_name2=new_central_bead_name, 
 698                                            hard_check=True, 
 699                                            use_default_bond=use_default_bond)                
 700                    l0 = self.get_bond_length(particle_name1=previous_central_bead_name, 
 701                                              particle_name2=new_central_bead_name, 
 702                                              hard_check=True, 
 703                                              use_default_bond=use_default_bond)                
 704                    residue_position = residue_position+backbone_vector*l0
 705                    residues_info = self.create_residue(name=residue, 
 706                                                                    number_of_residues=1, 
 707                                                                    espresso_system=espresso_system, 
 708                                                                    central_bead_position=[residue_position],
 709                                                                    use_default_bond= use_default_bond)
 710                    residue_id = next(iter(residues_info))      
 711                    for index in self.df[self.df['residue_id']==residue_id].index:
 712                        if not self.check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(index=index,key=('molecule_id','')):
 713                            self.df.at[index,'molecule_id'] = molecule_id
 714                            self.add_value_to_df(key=('molecule_id',''),
 715                                                index=int (index),
 716                                                new_value=molecule_id,
 717                                                warning=False)            
 718                    central_bead_id = residues_info[residue_id]['central_bead_id']
 719                    espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).add_bond((bond, previous_residue_id))
 720                    self.add_bond_in_df(particle_id1=central_bead_id,
 721                                        particle_id2=previous_residue_id,
 722                                        use_default_bond=use_default_bond)            
 723                    previous_residue_id = central_bead_id
 724                    previous_residue = residue                    
 725                molecule_info.append(residues_info)
 726            first_residue = True
 727        return molecule_info
 728    
 729    def create_particle(self, name, espresso_system, number_of_particles, position=None, fix=False):
 730        """
 731        Creates `number_of_particles` particles of type `name` into `espresso_system` and bookkeeps them into `pymbe.df`.
 732        
 733        Args:
 734            name (`str`): Label of the particle type to be created. `name` must be a `particle` defined in `pmb_df`. 
 735            espresso_system (`cls`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
 736            number_of_particles (`int`): Number of particles to be created.
 737            position (list of [`float`,`float`,`float`], optional): Initial positions of the particles. If not given, particles are created in random positions. Defaults to None.
 738            fix(`bool`, optional): Controls if the particle motion is frozen in the integrator, it is used to create rigid objects. Defaults to False.
 739        Returns:
 740            created_pid_list(`list` of `float`): List with the ids of the particles created into `espresso_system`.
 741        """       
 742        if number_of_particles <=0:
 743            return
 744        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='particle'):
 745            raise ValueError(f"{name} must correspond to a label of a pmb_type='particle' defined on df")
 746        # Copy the data of the particle `number_of_particles` times in the `df`
 747        self.copy_df_entry(name=name,column_name='particle_id',number_of_copies=number_of_particles)
 748        # Get information from the particle type `name` from the df     
 749        q = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_one.charge.values[0]
 750        es_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_one.es_type.values[0]
 751        # Get a list of the index in `df` corresponding to the new particles to be created
 752        index = self.np.where(self.df['name']==name)
 753        index_list =list(index[0])[-number_of_particles:]
 754        # Create the new particles into  `espresso_system`
 755        created_pid_list=[]
 756        for index in range (number_of_particles):
 757            df_index=int (index_list[index])
 758            self.clean_df_row(index=df_index)
 759            if position is None:
 760                particle_position = self.np.random.random((1, 3))[0] *self.np.copy(espresso_system.box_l)
 761            else:
 762                particle_position = position[index]
 763            if len(espresso_system.part.all()) == 0:
 764                bead_id = 0
 765            else:
 766                bead_id = max (espresso_system.part.all().id) + 1
 767            created_pid_list.append(bead_id)
 768            
 769            if fix:
 770                espresso_system.part.add (id=bead_id, pos = particle_position, type = es_type, q = q,fix =[fix,fix,fix])        
 771            else:
 772                espresso_system.part.add (id=bead_id, pos = particle_position, type = es_type, q = q)        
 773            self.add_value_to_df(key=('particle_id',''),index=df_index,new_value=bead_id, warning=False)                  
 774        return created_pid_list
 775
 776    def create_pmb_object (self, name, number_of_objects, espresso_system, position=None, use_default_bond=False):
 777        """
 778        Creates all `particle`s associated to `pmb object` into  `espresso` a number of times equal to `number_of_objects`.
 779        
 780        Args:
 781            name(`str`): Unique label of the `pmb object` to be created. 
 782            number_of_objects(`int`): Number of `pmb object`s to be created.
 783            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of an espresso system object from espressomd library.
 784            position(`list`): Coordinates where the particles should be created.
 785            use_default_bond(`bool`,optional): Controls if a `default` bond is used to bond particles with undefined bonds in `pmb.df`. Defaults to `False`.
 786
 787        Note:
 788            - If no `position` is given, particles will be created in random positions. For bonded particles, they will be created at a distance equal to the bond length. 
 789        """
 790        allowed_objects=['particle','residue','molecule']
 791        pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]
 792        if pmb_type not in allowed_objects:
 793            raise ValueError('Object type not supported, supported types are ', allowed_objects)
 794        if pmb_type == 'particle':
 795            self.create_particle(name=name, number_of_particles=number_of_objects, espresso_system=espresso_system, position=position)
 796        elif pmb_type == 'residue':
 797            self.create_residue(name=name,number_of_residues=number_of_objects, espresso_system=espresso_system, central_bead_position=position,use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 798        elif pmb_type == 'molecule':
 799            self.create_molecule(name=name,number_of_molecules=number_of_objects, espresso_system=espresso_system, use_default_bond=use_default_bond, first_residue_position=position)
 800        return
 801
 802    def create_protein(self, name, number_of_proteins, espresso_system, topology_dict):
 803        """
 804        Creates `number_of_proteins` molecules of type `name` into `espresso_system` at the coordinates in `positions`
 805
 806        Args:
 807            name(`str`): Label of the protein to be created. 
 808            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
 809            number_of_proteins(`int`): Number of proteins to be created.
 810            positions(`dict`): {'ResidueNumber': {'initial_pos': [], 'chain_id': ''}}
 811        """
 812
 813        if number_of_proteins <=0:
 814            return
 815        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,
 816                                                  pmb_type_to_be_defined='protein'):
 817            raise ValueError(f"{name} must correspond to a name of a pmb_type='protein' defined on df")
 818
 819        self.copy_df_entry(name=name,column_name='molecule_id',number_of_copies=number_of_proteins)
 820
 821        protein_index = self.np.where(self.df['name']==name)
 822        protein_index_list =list(protein_index[0])[-number_of_proteins:]
 823        used_molecules_id = self.df.molecule_id.dropna().drop_duplicates().tolist()
 824        
 825        box_half=espresso_system.box_l[0]/2.0
 826
 827        for molecule_index in protein_index_list:     
 828
 829            molecule_id = self.assign_molecule_id (name=name,pmb_type='protein',used_molecules_id=used_molecules_id,molecule_index=molecule_index)
 830
 831            protein_center = self.generate_coordinates_outside_sphere(radius = 1, 
 832                                                                        max_dist=box_half, 
 833                                                                        n_samples=1, 
 834                                                                        center=[box_half]*3)[0]
 835   
 836            for residue in topology_dict.keys():
 837
 838                residue_name = self.re.split(r'\d+', residue)[0]
 839                residue_number = self.re.split(r'(\d+)', residue)[1]
 840                residue_position = topology_dict[residue]['initial_pos']
 841                position = residue_position + protein_center
 842
 843                particle_id = self.create_particle(name=residue_name,
 844                                                            espresso_system=espresso_system,
 845                                                            number_of_particles=1,
 846                                                            position=[position], 
 847                                                            fix = True)
 848
 849                index = self.df[self.df['particle_id']==particle_id[0]].index.values[0]
 850
 851                self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),
 852                                            index=int (index),
 853                                            new_value=residue_number)
 854
 855                self.add_value_to_df(key=('molecule_id',''),
 856                                        index=int (index),
 857                                        new_value=molecule_id)
 858
 859        return
 860
 861    def create_residue(self, name, espresso_system, number_of_residues, central_bead_position=None,use_default_bond=False, backbone_vector=None):
 862        """
 863        Creates `number_of_residues` residues of type `name` into `espresso_system` and bookkeeps them into `pmb.df`.
 864
 865        Args:
 866            name(`str`): Label of the residue type to be created. `name` must be defined in `pmb.df`
 867            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from espressomd library.
 868            number_of_residue(`int`): Number of residues of type `name` to be created.
 869            central_bead_position(`list` of `float`): Position of the central bead.
 870            use_default_bond (`bool`): Switch to control if a bond of type `default` is used to bond a particle whose bonds types are not defined in `pmb.df`
 871            backbone_vector (`list` of `float`): Backbone vector of the molecule. All side chains are created perpendicularly to `backbone_vector`.
 872
 873        Returns:
 874            residues_info (`dict`): {residue_id:{"central_bead_id":central_bead_id, "side_chain_ids":[particle_id1, ...]}}
 875        """
 876        if number_of_residues <= 0:
 877            return
 878        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,
 879                                                    pmb_type_to_be_defined='residue'):
 880            raise ValueError(f"{name} must correspond to a label of a pmb_type='residue' defined on df")
 881        # Copy the data of a residue a `number_of_residues` times in the `df
 882        self.copy_df_entry(name=name,
 883                            column_name='residue_id',
 884                            number_of_copies=number_of_residues)
 885        residues_index = self.np.where(self.df['name']==name)
 886        residue_index_list =list(residues_index[0])[-number_of_residues:]
 887        # Internal bookkepping of the residue info (important for side-chain residues)
 888        # Dict structure {residue_id:{"central_bead_id":central_bead_id, "side_chain_ids":[particle_id1, ...]}}
 889        residues_info={}
 890        for residue_index in residue_index_list:     
 891            self.clean_df_row(index=int(residue_index))
 892            # Assign a residue_id
 893            if self.df['residue_id'].isnull().all():
 894                residue_id=0
 895            else:
 896                residue_id = self.df['residue_id'].max() + 1
 897            self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),index=int (residue_index),new_value=residue_id, warning=False)
 898            # create the principal bead
 899            if self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].central_bead.values[0] is self.np.NaN:
 900                raise ValueError("central_bead must contain a particle name")        
 901            central_bead_name = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].central_bead.values[0]            
 902            central_bead_id = self.create_particle(name=central_bead_name,
 903                                                                espresso_system=espresso_system,
 904                                                                position=central_bead_position,
 905                                                                number_of_particles = 1)[0]
 906            central_bead_position=espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).pos
 907            #assigns same residue_id to the central_bead particle created.
 908            index = self.df[self.df['particle_id']==central_bead_id].index.values[0]
 909            self.df.at [index,'residue_id'] = residue_id
 910            # Internal bookkeeping of the central bead id
 911            residues_info[residue_id]={}
 912            residues_info[residue_id]['central_bead_id']=central_bead_id
 913            # create the lateral beads  
 914            side_chain_list = self.df.loc[self.df.index[residue_index]].side_chains.values[0]
 915            side_chain_beads_ids = []
 916            for side_chain_element in side_chain_list:
 917                if side_chain_element not in self.df.values:              
 918                        raise ValueError (side_chain_element +'is not defined')
 919                pmb_type = self.df[self.df['name']==side_chain_element].pmb_type.values[0] 
 920                if pmb_type == 'particle':
 921                    bond = self.search_bond(particle_name1=central_bead_name, 
 922                                            particle_name2=side_chain_element, 
 923                                            hard_check=True, 
 924                                            use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 925                    l0 = self.get_bond_length(particle_name1=central_bead_name, 
 926                                              particle_name2=side_chain_element, 
 927                                              hard_check=True, 
 928                                              use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 929                    if backbone_vector is None:
 930                        bead_position=self.generate_trialvectors(center=central_bead_position, 
 931                                                                 radius=l0, 
 932                                                                 n_samples=1,
 933                                                                 on_surface=True)[0]
 934                    else:
 935                        bead_position=self.generate_trial_perpendicular_vector(vector=backbone_vector,
 936                                                                            center=central_bead_position, 
 937                                                                            radius=l0)
 938                        
 939                    side_bead_id = self.create_particle(name=side_chain_element, 
 940                                                                    espresso_system=espresso_system,
 941                                                                    position=[bead_position], 
 942                                                                    number_of_particles=1)[0]
 943                    index = self.df[self.df['particle_id']==side_bead_id].index.values[0]
 944                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),
 945                                        index=int (index),
 946                                        new_value=residue_id, 
 947                                        warning=False)
 948                    side_chain_beads_ids.append(side_bead_id)
 949                    espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).add_bond((bond, side_bead_id))
 950                    self.add_bond_in_df(particle_id1=central_bead_id,
 951                                        particle_id2=side_bead_id,
 952                                        use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 953                elif pmb_type == 'residue':
 954                    central_bead_side_chain = self.df[self.df['name']==side_chain_element].central_bead.values[0]
 955                    bond = self.search_bond(particle_name1=central_bead_name, 
 956                                            particle_name2=central_bead_side_chain, 
 957                                            hard_check=True, 
 958                                            use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 959                    l0 = self.get_bond_length(particle_name1=central_bead_name, 
 960                                              particle_name2=central_bead_side_chain, 
 961                                              hard_check=True, 
 962                                              use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 963                    if backbone_vector is None:
 964                        residue_position=self.generate_trialvectors(center=central_bead_position, 
 965                                                                    radius=l0, 
 966                                                                    n_samples=1,
 967                                                                    on_surface=True)[0]
 968                    else:
 969                        residue_position=self.generate_trial_perpendicular_vector(vector=backbone_vector,
 970                                                                                center=central_bead_position, 
 971                                                                                radius=l0)
 972                    lateral_residue_info = self.create_residue(name=side_chain_element, espresso_system=espresso_system,
 973                        number_of_residues=1, central_bead_position=[residue_position],use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 974                    lateral_residue_dict=list(lateral_residue_info.values())[0]
 975                    central_bead_side_chain_id=lateral_residue_dict['central_bead_id']
 976                    lateral_beads_side_chain_ids=lateral_residue_dict['side_chain_ids']
 977                    residue_id_side_chain=list(lateral_residue_info.keys())[0]
 978                    # Change the residue_id of the residue in the side chain to the one of the biger residue
 979                    index = self.df[(self.df['residue_id']==residue_id_side_chain) & (self.df['pmb_type']=='residue') ].index.values[0]
 980                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),
 981                                        index=int(index),
 982                                        new_value=residue_id, 
 983                                        warning=False)
 984                    # Change the residue_id of the particles in the residue in the side chain
 985                    side_chain_beads_ids+=[central_bead_side_chain_id]+lateral_beads_side_chain_ids
 986                    for particle_id in side_chain_beads_ids:
 987                        index = self.df[(self.df['particle_id']==particle_id) & (self.df['pmb_type']=='particle')].index.values[0]
 988                        self.add_value_to_df(key=('residue_id',''),
 989                                            index=int (index),
 990                                            new_value=residue_id, 
 991                                            warning=False)
 992                    espresso_system.part.by_id(central_bead_id).add_bond((bond, central_bead_side_chain_id))
 993                    self.add_bond_in_df(particle_id1=central_bead_id,
 994                                        particle_id2=central_bead_side_chain_id,
 995                                        use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
 996            # Internal bookkeeping of the side chain beads ids
 997            residues_info[residue_id]['side_chain_ids']=side_chain_beads_ids
 998        return  residues_info
 999
1000    def create_variable_with_units(self, variable_dict):
1001        """
1002        Returns a pint object with the value and units defined in `variable_dict`.
1003
1004        Args:
1005            variable_dict(`dict`): {'value': value, 'units': units}
1006        Returns:
1007            variable_with_units(`obj`): variable with units using the pyMBE UnitRegistry.
1008        """        
1009        value=variable_dict.pop('value')
1010        units=variable_dict.pop('units')
1011        variable_with_units=value*self.units(units)
1012
1013        return variable_with_units
1014
1015    def define_AA_particles_in_sequence(self, sequence):
1016        '''
1017        Defines in `pmb.df` all the different particles in `sequence`.
1018
1019        Args:
1020            sequence(`lst`):  Sequence of the peptide or protein. 
1021
1022        Note:
1023            - It assumes that the names in `sequence` correspond to amino acid names using the standard one letter code.
1024        '''
1025
1026        already_defined_AA=[]
1027        acidic_aminoacids = ['c','E','D','Y','C']
1028        basic_aminoacids  = ['R','n','K','H']
1029
1030        for residue_name in sequence:
1031            if residue_name in already_defined_AA:
1032                continue
1033            if residue_name in acidic_aminoacids:
1034                self.define_particle (name=residue_name, acidity='acidic')
1035            elif residue_name in basic_aminoacids:
1036                self.define_particle (name=residue_name, acidity='basic')
1037            else:
1038                self.define_particle (name=residue_name, q=0)
1039        return 
1040
1041    def define_AA_residues(self, sequence, model):
1042        """
1043        Defines in `pmb.df` all the different residues in `sequence`.
1044
1045        Args:
1046            sequence(`lst`):  Sequence of the peptide or protein.
1047            model (`string`): Model name. Currently only models with 1 bead '1beadAA' or with 2 beads '2beadAA' per amino acid are supported.
1048
1049        Returns:
1050            residue_list (`list` of `str`): List of the `name`s of the `residue`s  in the sequence of the `molecule`.             
1051        """
1052        residue_list = []
1053        for residue_name in sequence:
1054            if model == '1beadAA':
1055                central_bead = residue_name
1056                side_chains = []
1057            elif model == '2beadAA':
1058                if residue_name in ['c','n', 'G']: 
1059                    central_bead = residue_name
1060                    side_chains = []
1061                else:
1062                    central_bead = 'CA'              
1063                    side_chains = [residue_name]
1064            if residue_name not in residue_list:   
1065                self.define_residue(name = 'AA-'+residue_name, 
1066                                    central_bead = central_bead,
1067                                    side_chains = side_chains)              
1068            residue_list.append('AA-'+residue_name)
1069        return residue_list
1070 
1071    def define_bond(self, bond_object, bond_type, particle_name1, particle_name2):
1072        """
1073        Defines a pmb object of type `bond` in `pymbe.df`
1074        
1075        Args:
1076            bond_object (`cls`): instance of a bond object from espressomd library
1077            bond_type (`str`): label identifying the used bonded potential
1078            particle_name1 (`str`): `name` of the first `particle` to be bonded.
1079            particle_name2 (`str`): `name` of the second `particle` to be bonded.
1080        
1081        Note:
1082            - Currently, only harmonic and FENE bonds are supported.
1083        """    
1084        
1085        valid_bond_types=["harmonic", "FENE"]
1086        if bond_type not in valid_bond_types:
1087                       raise ValueError(f"Bond type {bond_type} currently not implemented in pyMBE, valid types are {valid_bond_types}")
1088
1089        lj_parameters=self.get_lj_parameters(particle_name1=particle_name1, 
1090                                        particle_name2=particle_name2, 
1091                                        combining_rule='Lorentz-Berthelot')
1092
1093        cutoff = 2**(1.0/6.0) * lj_parameters["sigma"]
1094        l0 = self.calculate_initial_bond_length(bond_object=bond_object, 
1095                                                bond_type=bond_type, 
1096                                                epsilon=lj_parameters["epsilon"],
1097                                                sigma=lj_parameters["sigma"],
1098                                                cutoff=cutoff)
1099
1100        index = len(self.df)
1101        for label in [particle_name1+'-'+particle_name2,particle_name2+'-'+particle_name1]:
1102            self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=label, pmb_type_to_be_defined="bond")
1103        self.df.at [index,'name']= particle_name1+'-'+particle_name2
1104        self.df.at [index,'bond_object'] = bond_object
1105        self.df.at [index,'l0'] = l0
1106        self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
1107                                key=('pmb_type',''),
1108                                new_value='bond')
1109        self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
1110                                key=('parameters_of_the_potential',''),
1111                                new_value=self.json.dumps(bond_object.get_params()))
1112        return
1113
1114    def define_default_bond(self, bond_object, bond_type, epsilon=None, sigma=None, cutoff=None):
1115        """
1116        Asigns `bond` in `pmb.df` as the default bond.
1117        The LJ parameters can be optionally provided to calculate the initial bond length
1118
1119        Args:
1120            bond (`obj`): instance of a bond object from the espressomd library.
1121            bond_type (`str`): label identifying the used bonded potential
1122            sigma (`float`, optional): LJ sigma of the interaction between the particles
1123            epsilon (`float`, optional): LJ epsilon for the interaction between the particles
1124            cutoff (`float`, optional): cutoff-radius of the LJ interaction
1125
1126        Note:
1127            - Currently, only harmonic and FENE bonds are supported. 
1128        """
1129        valid_bond_types=["harmonic", "FENE"]
1130        if bond_type not in valid_bond_types:
1131            raise ValueError(f"Bond type {bond_type} currently not implemented in pyMBE, valid types are {valid_bond_types}")
1132        if epsilon is None:
1133            epsilon=1*self.units('reduced_energy')
1134        if sigma is None:
1135            sigma=1*self.units('reduced_length')
1136        if cutoff is None:
1137            cutoff=2**(1.0/6.0)*self.units('reduced_length')
1138        l0 = self.calculate_initial_bond_length(bond_object=bond_object, 
1139                                                bond_type=bond_type, 
1140                                                epsilon=epsilon,
1141                                                sigma=sigma,
1142                                                cutoff=cutoff)
1143
1144        if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name='default',pmb_type_to_be_defined='bond'):
1145            return
1146        if len(self.df.index) != 0:
1147            index = max(self.df.index)+1
1148        else:
1149            index = 0
1150        self.df.at [index,'name'] = 'default'
1151        self.df.at [index,'bond_object'] = bond_object
1152        self.df.at [index,'l0'] = l0
1153        self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
1154                            key=('pmb_type',''),
1155                            new_value='bond')
1156        self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
1157                            key=('parameters_of_the_potential',''),
1158                            new_value=self.json.dumps(bond_object.get_params()))
1159        return
1160
1161    def define_epsilon_value_of_particles(self, eps_dict):
1162        '''
1163        Defines the epsilon value of the particles in `eps_dict` into the `pmb.df`.
1164
1165        Args:
1166            eps_dict(`dict`):  {'name': epsilon}
1167        '''
1168        for residue in eps_dict.keys():
1169            label_list = self.df[self.df['name'] == residue].index.tolist()
1170            for index in label_list:
1171                epsilon = eps_dict[residue]
1172                self.add_value_to_df(key= ('epsilon',''),
1173                        index=int (index),
1174                        new_value=epsilon)
1175        return 
1176
1177    def define_molecule(self, name, residue_list):
1178        """
1179        Defines a pyMBE object of type `molecule` in `pymbe.df`.
1180
1181        Args:
1182            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `molecule`.
1183            residue_list (`list` of `str`): List of the `name`s of the `residue`s  in the sequence of the `molecule`.  
1184        """
1185        if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='molecule'):
1186            return
1187        index = len(self.df)
1188        self.df.at [index,'name'] = name
1189        self.df.at [index,'pmb_type'] = 'molecule'
1190        self.df.at [index,('residue_list','')] = residue_list
1191        return
1192
1193    def define_particle(self, name, q=0, diameter=None, acidity='inert', epsilon=None, pka=None):
1194        """
1195        Defines a pyMBE object of type `particle` in `pymbe.df`
1196
1197        Args:
1198            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `particle`.  
1199            q (`int`, optional): Charge of the `particle`. Defaults to 0.
1200            diameter (`obj`, optional): Diameter used to setup Lennard-Jones interactions for the `particle`, should have units of length using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
1201            epsilon (`obj`, optional): Epsilon parameter used to setup Lennard-Jones interactions for the `particle`, should have units of energy using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry.. Defaults to None
1202            acidity (`str`, optional): Identifies whether if the particle is `acidic` or `basic`, used to setup constant pH simulations. Defaults to `inert`.
1203            pka (`float`, optional): If `particle` is an acid or a base, it defines its  pka-value. Defaults to None.
1204        """ 
1205        if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='particle'):
1206            index = self.df[self.df['name']==name].index[0]                                   
1207        else:
1208            index = len(self.df)
1209            self.df.at [index, 'name'] = name
1210            self.df.at [index,'pmb_type'] = 'particle'
1211            
1212        if diameter:
1213            self.add_value_to_df(key=('diameter',''),index=index,new_value=diameter)
1214        if epsilon:
1215            self.add_value_to_df(key=('epsilon',''),index=index,new_value=epsilon)        
1216        
1217        self.set_particle_acidity ( name=name, acidity = acidity , default_charge=q, pka=pka)
1218        return 
1219    
1220    def define_particles_parameter_from_dict(self, param_dict, param_name):
1221        '''
1222        Defines the `param_name` value of the particles in `param_dict` into the `pmb.df`.
1223
1224        Args:
1225            param_dict(`dict`):  {'name': `param_name` value}
1226        '''
1227        for residue in param_dict.keys():
1228            label_list = self.df[self.df['name'] == residue].index.tolist()
1229            for index in label_list:
1230                value = param_dict[residue]
1231                self.add_value_to_df(key= (param_name,''),
1232                        index=int (index),
1233                        new_value=value)
1234        return 
1235    
1236    def define_peptide(self, name, sequence, model):
1237        """
1238        Defines a pyMBE object of type `peptide` in the `pymbe.df`.
1239
1240        Args:
1241            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `peptide`.
1242            sequence (`string`): Sequence of the `peptide`.
1243            model (`string`): Model name. Currently only models with 1 bead '1beadAA' or with 2 beads '2beadAA' per amino acid are supported.
1244        """
1245        if not self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name = name, pmb_type_to_be_defined='peptide'):
1246            valid_keys = ['1beadAA','2beadAA']
1247            if model not in valid_keys:
1248                raise ValueError('Invalid label for the peptide model, please choose between 1beadAA or 2beadAA')
1249        
1250            clean_sequence = self.protein_sequence_parser(sequence=sequence)    
1251            residue_list = self.define_AA_residues(sequence=clean_sequence,model=model)
1252
1253            self.define_molecule(name = name, residue_list=residue_list)
1254            index = self.df.loc[self.df['name'] == name].index.item() 
1255            self.df.at [index,'model'] = model
1256            self.df.at [index,('sequence','')] = clean_sequence
1257        return
1258    
1259    def define_protein(self, name,model, topology_dict):
1260        """
1261        Defines a pyMBE object of type `protein` in `pymbe.df`.
1262
1263        Args:
1264            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `protein`.
1265            model (`string`): Model name. Currently only models with 1 bead '1beadAA' or with 2 beads '2beadAA' per amino acid are supported.
1266            topology_dict (`dict`): {'initial_pos': coords_list, 'chain_id': id, 'diameter': diameter_value}
1267        """
1268
1269        protein_seq_list = []     
1270    
1271        valid_keys = ['1beadAA','2beadAA']
1272
1273        if model not in valid_keys:
1274            raise ValueError('Invalid label for the peptide model, please choose between 1beadAA or 2beadAA')
1275        
1276        if model == '2beadAA':
1277            self.define_particle(name='CA')
1278
1279        for residue in topology_dict.keys():
1280            residue_name = self.re.split(r'\d+', residue)[0]
1281            if residue_name != 'CA' and residue_name != 'Ca':
1282                protein_seq_list.append(residue_name)                  
1283
1284        protein_sequence = ''.join(protein_seq_list)
1285        clean_sequence = self.protein_sequence_parser(sequence=protein_sequence)
1286
1287        self.define_AA_particles_in_sequence (sequence=clean_sequence)
1288        residue_list = self.define_AA_residues(sequence=clean_sequence, model=model)
1289
1290        index = len(self.df)
1291        self.df.at [index,'name'] = name
1292        self.df.at [index,'pmb_type'] = 'protein'
1293        self.df.at [index,'model'] = model
1294        self.df.at [index,('sequence','')] = clean_sequence  
1295        self.df.at [index,('residue_list','')] = residue_list    
1296
1297        return 
1298    
1299    def define_residue(self, name, central_bead, side_chains):
1300        """
1301        Defines a pyMBE object of type `residue` in `pymbe.df`.
1302
1303        Args:
1304            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `residue`.
1305            central_bead (`str`): `name` of the `particle` to be placed as central_bead of the `residue`.
1306            side_chains (`list` of `str`): List of `name`s of the pmb_objects to be placed as side_chains of the `residue`. Currently, only pmb_objects of type `particle`s or `residue`s are supported.
1307        """
1308        if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name=name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='residue'):
1309            return
1310        index = len(self.df)
1311        self.df.at [index, 'name'] = name
1312        self.df.at [index,'pmb_type'] = 'residue'
1313        self.df.at [index,'central_bead'] = central_bead
1314        self.df.at [index,('side_chains','')] = side_chains
1315        return 
1316
1317    def destroy_pmb_object_in_system(self, name, espresso_system):
1318        """
1319        Destroys all particles associated with `name` in `espresso_system` amd removes the destroyed pmb_objects from `pmb.df` 
1320
1321        Args:
1322            name (str): Label of the pmb object to be destroyed. The pmb object must be defined in `pymbe.df`.
1323            espresso_system (cls): Instance of a system class from espressomd library.
1324
1325        Note:
1326            - If `name`  is a object_type=`particle`, only the matching particles that are not part of bigger objects (e.g. `residue`, `molecule`) will be destroyed. To destroy particles in such objects, destroy the bigger object instead.
1327        """
1328        allowed_objects = ['particle','residue','molecule']
1329        pmb_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].pmb_type.values[0]
1330        if pmb_type not in allowed_objects:
1331            raise ValueError('Object type not supported, supported types are ', allowed_objects)
1332        if pmb_type == 'particle':
1333            particles_index = self.df.index[(self.df['name'] == name) & (self.df['residue_id'].isna()) 
1334                                                  & (self.df['molecule_id'].isna())]
1335            particle_ids_list= self.df.loc[(self.df['name'] == name) & (self.df['residue_id'].isna())
1336                                                 & (self.df['molecule_id'].isna())].particle_id.tolist()
1337            for particle_id in particle_ids_list:
1338                espresso_system.part.by_id(particle_id).remove()
1339            self.df = self.df.drop(index=particles_index)
1340        if pmb_type == 'residue':
1341            residues_id = self.df.loc[self.df['name']== name].residue_id.to_list()
1342            for residue_id in residues_id:
1343                particle_ids_list = self.df.loc[self.df['residue_id']==residue_id].particle_id.dropna().to_list()
1344                self.df = self.df.drop(self.df[self.df['residue_id'] == residue_id].index)
1345                for particle_id in particle_ids_list:
1346                    espresso_system.part.by_id(particle_id).remove()
1347                    self.df= self.df.drop(self.df[self.df['particle_id']==particle_id].index)    
1348        if pmb_type == 'molecule':
1349            molecules_id = self.df.loc[self.df['name']== name].molecule_id.to_list()
1350            for molecule_id in molecules_id:
1351                particle_ids_list = self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']==molecule_id].particle_id.dropna().to_list()
1352                
1353                self.df = self.df.drop(self.df[self.df['molecule_id'] == molecule_id].index)
1354                for particle_id in particle_ids_list:
1355                    espresso_system.part.by_id(particle_id).remove()   
1356                    self.df= self.df.drop(self.df[self.df['particle_id']==particle_id].index)             
1357        
1358        self.df.reset_index(drop=True,inplace=True)
1359
1360        return
1361
