1362    def determine_reservoir_concentrations(self, pH_res, c_salt_res, activity_coefficient_monovalent_pair, max_number_sc_runs=200):
1363        """
1364        Determines the concentrations of the various species in the reservoir for given values of the pH and salt concentration.
1365        To do this, a system of nonlinear equations involving the pH, the ionic product of water, the activity coefficient of an
1366        ion pair and the concentrations of the various species is solved numerically using a self-consistent approach.
1367        More details can be found in chapter 5.3 of Landsgesell (doi.org/10.18419/opus-10831).
1368        This is a modified version of the code by Landsgesell et al. (doi.org/10.18419/darus-2237).
1369
1370        Args:
1371            pH_res ('float'): pH-value in the reservoir.
1372            c_salt_res ('float'): Concentration of monovalent salt (e.g. NaCl) in the reservoir.
1373            activity_coefficient_monovalent_pair ('callable', optional): A function that calculates the activity coefficient of an ion pair as a function of the ionic strength.
1374
1375        Returns:
1376            cH_res ('float'): Concentration of H+ ions.
1377            cOH_res ('float'): Concentration of OH- ions.
1378            cNa_res ('float'): Concentration of Na+ ions.
1379            cCl_res ('float'): Concentration of Cl- ions.
1380        """
1381
1382        self_consistent_run = 0
1383        cH_res = 10**(-pH_res) * self.units.mol/self.units.l #initial guess for the concentration of H+
1384        KW = 1e-14 * self.units.mol**2 / (self.units.l**2)
1385
1386        def determine_reservoir_concentrations_selfconsistently(cH_res, c_salt_res):
1387            #Calculate and initial guess for the concentrations of various species based on ideal gas estimate
1388            cOH_res = KW / cH_res 
1389            cNa_res = None
1390            cCl_res = None
1391            if (cOH_res>=cH_res):
1392                #adjust the concentration of sodium if there is excess OH- in the reservoir:
1393                cNa_res = c_salt_res + (cOH_res-cH_res)
1394                cCl_res = c_salt_res
1395            else:
1396                # adjust the concentration of chloride if there is excess H+ in the reservoir
1397                cCl_res = c_salt_res + (cH_res-cOH_res)
1398                cNa_res = c_salt_res
1399                
1400            def calculate_concentrations_self_consistently(cH_res, cOH_res, cNa_res, cCl_res):
1401                nonlocal max_number_sc_runs, self_consistent_run
1402                if(self_consistent_run<max_number_sc_runs):
1403                    self_consistent_run+=1
1404                    ionic_strength_res = 0.5*(cNa_res+cCl_res+cOH_res+cH_res)
1405                    cOH_res = KW / (cH_res * activity_coefficient_monovalent_pair(ionic_strength_res))
1406                    if (cOH_res>=cH_res):
1407                        #adjust the concentration of sodium if there is excess OH- in the reservoir:
1408                        cNa_res = c_salt_res + (cOH_res-cH_res)
1409                        cCl_res = c_salt_res
1410                    else:
1411                        # adjust the concentration of chloride if there is excess H+ in the reservoir
1412                        cCl_res = c_salt_res + (cH_res-cOH_res)
1413                        cNa_res = c_salt_res
1414                    return calculate_concentrations_self_consistently(cH_res, cOH_res, cNa_res, cCl_res)
1415                else:
1416                    return cH_res, cOH_res, cNa_res, cCl_res
1417            return calculate_concentrations_self_consistently(cH_res, cOH_res, cNa_res, cCl_res)
1418
1419        cH_res, cOH_res, cNa_res, cCl_res = determine_reservoir_concentrations_selfconsistently(cH_res, c_salt_res)
1420        ionic_strength_res = 0.5*(cNa_res+cCl_res+cOH_res+cH_res)
1421        determined_pH = -self.np.log10(cH_res.to('mol/L').magnitude * self.np.sqrt(activity_coefficient_monovalent_pair(ionic_strength_res)))
1422
1423        while abs(determined_pH-pH_res)>1e-6:
1424            if (determined_pH>pH_res):
1425                cH_res *= 1.005
1426            else:
1427                cH_res /= 1.003
1428            cH_res, cOH_res, cNa_res, cCl_res = determine_reservoir_concentrations_selfconsistently(cH_res, c_salt_res)
1429            ionic_strength_res = 0.5*(cNa_res+cCl_res+cOH_res+cH_res)
1430            determined_pH = -self.np.log10(cH_res.to('mol/L').magnitude * self.np.sqrt(activity_coefficient_monovalent_pair(ionic_strength_res)))
1431            self_consistent_run=0
1432
1433        return cH_res, cOH_res, cNa_res, cCl_res
1434
1435    def filter_df(self, pmb_type):
1436        """
1437        Filters `pmb.df` and returns a sub-set of it containing only rows with pmb_object_type=`pmb_type` and non-NaN columns.
1438        
1439        Args:
1440            pmb_type(`str`): pmb_object_type to filter in `pmb.df`.
1441
1442        Returns:
1443            pmb_type_df(`obj`): filtered `pmb.df`.
1444        """
1445        pmb_type_df = self.df.loc[self.df['pmb_type']== pmb_type]
1446        pmb_type_df = pmb_type_df.dropna( axis=1, thresh=1)
1447        return pmb_type_df
1448
1449    def find_bond_key(self, particle_name1, particle_name2, use_default_bond=False):
1450        """
1451        Searches for the `name` of the bond between `particle_name1` and `particle_name2` in `pymbe.df` and returns it.
1452        
1453        Args:
1454            particle_name1(`str`): label of the type of the first particle type of the bonded particles.
1455            particle_name2(`str`): label of the type of the second particle type of the bonded particles.
1456            use_default_bond(`bool`, optional): If it is activated, the "default" bond is returned if no bond is found between `particle_name1` and `particle_name2`. Defaults to 'False'. 
1457
1458        Returns:
1459            bond_key (str): `name` of the bond between `particle_name1` and `particle_name2` 
1460
1461        Note:
1462            - If `use_default_bond`=`True`, it returns "default" if no key is found.
1463        """
1464        bond_keys = [particle_name1 +'-'+ particle_name2, particle_name2 +'-'+ particle_name1 ]
1465        bond_defined=False
1466        for bond_key in bond_keys:
1467            if bond_key in self.df.values:
1468                bond_defined=True
1469                correct_key=bond_key
1470                break
1471        if bond_defined:
1472            return correct_key
1473        elif use_default_bond:
1474            return 'default'
1475        else:
1476            return 
1477
1478    def find_value_from_es_type(self, es_type, column_name):
1479        """
1480        Finds a value in `pmb.df` for a `column_name` and `es_type` pair.
1481
1482        Args:
1483            es_type(`int`): value of the espresso type
1484            column_name(`str`): name of the column in `pymbe.df`
1485
1486        Returns:
1487            Value in `pymbe.df` matching  `column_name` and `es_type`
1488        """
1489        idx = self.pd.IndexSlice
1490        for state in ['state_one', 'state_two']:
1491            index = self.np.where(self.df[(state, 'es_type')] == es_type)[0]
1492            
1493            if len(index) > 0:
1494                if column_name == 'label':
1495                    label = self.df.loc[idx[index[0]], idx[(state,column_name)]]
1496                    return label
1497                else: 
1498                    column_name_value = self.df.loc[idx[index[0]], idx[(column_name,'')]]
1499                    return column_name_value
1500        return None
1501
1502    def generate_coordinates_outside_sphere(self, center, radius, max_dist, n_samples):
1503
1504        """
1505        Generates coordinates outside a sphere centered at `center`.
1506
1507        Args:
1508            center(`lst`): Coordinates of the center of the sphere.
1509            radius(`float`): Radius of the sphere.
1510            max_dist(`float`): Maximum distance from the center of the spahre to generate coordinates.
1511            n_samples(`int`): Number of sample points.
1512
1513        Returns:
1514            coord_list(`lst`): Coordinates of the sample points.
1515        """
1516        if not radius > 0: 
1517            raise ValueError (f'The value of {radius} must be a positive value')
1518        if not radius < max_dist:
1519            raise ValueError(f'The min_dist ({radius} must be lower than the max_dist ({max_dist}))')
1520        coord_list = []
1521        counter = 0
1522        while counter<n_samples:
1523            coord = self.generate_trialvectors(center=center, radius=max_dist,n_samples=1)[0]
1524            if self.np.linalg.norm(coord-self.np.asarray(center))>=radius:
1525                coord_list.append (coord)
1526                counter += 1
1527        return coord_list
1528
1529    def generate_trial_perpendicular_vector(self, vector, center, radius):
1530        """
1531        Generates a random vector perpendicular to `vector`.
1532        
1533        Args:
1534            vector(`lst`): Coordinates of the vector.
1535            magnitude(`float`): magnitude of the vector perpendicular to `vector`.
1536
1537        Returns:
1538            perpendicular_vector(`np.array`): random vector perpendicular to `vector`.
1539        """
1540        np_vec=self.np.array(vector)
1541        if np_vec[1] == 0 and np_vec[2] == 0 and np_vec[0] == 1:
1542            raise ValueError('zero vector')
1543        perp_vec = self.np.cross(np_vec, self.generate_trialvectors(center=center, radius=radius, n_samples=1, on_surface=True)[0])
1544        norm_perp_vec = perp_vec/self.np.linalg.norm(perp_vec)
1545        return center+norm_perp_vec*radius  
1546    
1547    def generate_trialvectors(self, center, radius, n_samples, seed=None, on_surface=False):
1548        """
1549        Uniformly samples points from a hypersphere. If on_surface is set to True, the points are
1550        uniformly sampled from the surface of the hypersphere.
1551        
1552        Args:
1553            center(`lst`): Array with the coordinates of the center of the spheres.
1554            radius(`float`): Radius of the sphere.
1555            n_samples(`int`): Number of sample points to generate inside the sphere.
1556            seed (`int`, optional): Seed for the random number generator
1557            on_surface (`bool`, optional): If set to True, points will be uniformly sampled on the surface of the hypersphere.
1558
1559        Returns:
1560            samples(`list`): Coordinates of the sample points inside the hypersphere.
1561
1562        Note:
1563            - Algorithm from: https://baezortega.github.io/2018/10/14/hypersphere-sampling/
1564        """
1565        # initial values
1566        center=self.np.array(center)
1567        d = center.shape[0]
1568        # sample n_samples points in d dimensions from a standard normal distribution
1569        rng = self.np.random.default_rng(seed)
1570        samples = rng.normal(size=(n_samples, d))
1571        # make the samples lie on the surface of the unit hypersphere
1572        normalize_radii = self.np.linalg.norm(samples, axis=1)[:, self.np.newaxis]
1573        samples /= normalize_radii
1574
1575        if not on_surface:
1576            # make the samples lie inside the hypersphere with the correct density
1577            uniform_points = rng.uniform(size=n_samples)[:, self.np.newaxis]
1578            new_radii = self.np.power(uniform_points, 1/d)
1579            samples *= new_radii
1580
1581        # scale the points to have the correct radius and center
1582        samples = samples * radius + center
1583        return samples 
1584
1585    def get_bond_length(self, particle_name1, particle_name2, hard_check=False, use_default_bond=False) :
1586        """
1587        Searches for bonds between the particle types given by `particle_name1` and `particle_name2` in `pymbe.df` and returns the initial bond length.
1588        If `use_default_bond` is activated and a "default" bond is defined, returns the length of that default bond instead.
1589        If no bond is found, it prints a message and it does not return anything. If `hard_check` is activated, the code stops if no bond is found.
1590
1591        Args:
1592            particle_name1 (str): label of the type of the first particle type of the bonded particles.
1593            particle_name2 (str): label of the type of the second particle type of the bonded particles.
1594            hard_check (bool, optional): If it is activated, the code stops if no bond is found. Defaults to False. 
1595            use_default_bond (bool, optional): If it is activated, the "default" bond is returned if no bond is found between `particle_name1` and `particle_name2`. Defaults to False. 
1596
1597        Returns:
1598            l0 (`float`): bond length
1599        
1600        Note:
1601            - If `use_default_bond`=True and no bond is defined between `particle_name1` and `particle_name2`, it returns the default bond defined in `pmb.df`.
1602            - If `hard_check`=`True` stops the code when no bond is found.
1603        """
1604        bond_key = self.find_bond_key(particle_name1=particle_name1, 
1605                                    particle_name2=particle_name2, 
1606                                    use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
1607        if bond_key:
1608            return self.df[self.df['name']==bond_key].l0.values[0]
1609        else:
1610            print("Bond not defined between particles ", particle_name1, " and ", particle_name2)    
1611            if hard_check:
1612                raise KeyboardInterrupt
1613            else:
1614                return
1615
1616    def get_charge_map(self):
1617        '''
1618        Gets the charge of each `espresso_type` in `pymbe.df`.
1619        
1620        Returns:
1621            charge_map(`dict`): {espresso_type: charge}.
1622        '''
1623        if self.df.state_one['es_type'].isnull().values.any():         
1624            df_state_one = self.df.state_one.dropna()     
1625            df_state_two = self.df.state_two.dropna()  
1626        else:    
1627            df_state_one = self.df.state_one
1628            if self.df.state_two['es_type'].isnull().values.any():
1629                df_state_two = self.df.state_two.dropna()   
1630            else:
1631                df_state_two = self.df.state_two
1632        state_one = self.pd.Series (df_state_one.charge.values,index=df_state_one.es_type.values)
1633        state_two = self.pd.Series (df_state_two.charge.values,index=df_state_two.es_type.values)
1634        charge_map  = self.pd.concat([state_one,state_two],axis=0).to_dict()
1635        return charge_map
1636
1637    def get_lj_parameters(self, particle_name1, particle_name2, combining_rule='Lorentz-Berthelot'):
1638        """
1639        Returns the Lennard-Jones parameters for the interaction between the particle types given by 
1640        `particle_name1` and `particle_name2` in `pymbe.df`, calculated according to the provided combining rule.
1641
1642        Args:
1643            particle_name1 (str): label of the type of the first particle type
1644            particle_name2 (str): label of the type of the second particle type
1645            combining_rule (`string`, optional): combining rule used to calculate `sigma` and `epsilon` for the potential betwen a pair of particles. Defaults to 'Lorentz-Berthelot'.
1646
1647        Returns:
1648            {"epsilon": LJ epsilon, "sigma": LJ sigma}
1649
1650        Note:
1651            Currently, the only `combining_rule` supported is Lorentz-Berthelot.
1652        """
1653        supported_combining_rules=["Lorentz-Berthelot"]
1654
1655        if combining_rule not in supported_combining_rules:
1656            raise ValueError(f"Combining_rule {combining_rule} currently not implemented in pyMBE, valid keys are {supported_combining_rules}")
1657
1658        eps1 = self.df.loc[self.df["name"]==particle_name1].epsilon.iloc[0]
1659        sigma1 = self.df.loc[self.df["name"]==particle_name1].diameter.iloc[0]
1660        eps2 = self.df.loc[self.df["name"]==particle_name2].epsilon.iloc[0]
1661        sigma2 = self.df.loc[self.df["name"]==particle_name2].diameter.iloc[0]
1662        
1663        return {"epsilon": self.np.sqrt(eps1*eps2), "sigma": (sigma1+sigma2)/2.0}
1664
1665    def get_particle_id_map(self, object_name):
1666        '''
1667        Gets all the ids associated with the object with name `object_name` in `pmb.df`
1668
1669        Args:
1670            object_name(`str`): name of the object
1671        
1672        Returns:
1673            id_map(`dict`): dict of the structure {"all": [all_ids_with_object_name], "residue_map": {res_id: [particle_ids_in_res_id]}, "molecule_map": {mol_id: [particle_ids_in_mol_id]}, }
1674        '''
1675        object_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']== object_name].pmb_type.values[0]
1676        valid_types = ["particle", "molecule", "residue", "protein"]
1677        if object_type not in valid_types:
1678            raise ValueError(f"{object_name} is of pmb_type {object_type}, which is not supported by this function. Supported types are {valid_types}")
1679        id_list = []
1680        mol_map = {}
1681        res_map = {}
1682        def do_res_map(res_ids):
1683            for res_id in res_ids:
1684                res_list=self.df.loc[self.df['residue_id']== res_id].particle_id.dropna().tolist()
1685                res_map[res_id]=res_list
1686            return res_map
1687        if object_type in ['molecule', 'protein']:
1688            mol_ids = self.df.loc[self.df['name']== object_name].molecule_id.dropna().tolist()
1689            for mol_id in mol_ids:
1690                res_ids = set(self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']== mol_id].residue_id.dropna().tolist())
1691                res_map=do_res_map(res_ids=res_ids)    
1692                mol_list=self.df.loc[self.df['molecule_id']== mol_id].particle_id.dropna().tolist()
1693                id_list+=mol_list
1694                mol_map[mol_id]=mol_list
1695        elif object_type == 'residue':     
1696            res_ids = self.df.loc[self.df['name']== object_name].residue_id.dropna().tolist()
1697            res_map=do_res_map(res_ids=res_ids)
1698            id_list=[]
1699            for res_id_list in res_map.values():
1700                id_list+=res_id_list
1701        elif object_type == 'particle':
1702            id_list = self.df.loc[self.df['name']== object_name].particle_id.dropna().tolist()
1703        return {"all": id_list, "molecule_map": mol_map, "residue_map": res_map}
1704
1705    def get_pka_set(self):
1706        '''
1707        Gets the pka-values and acidities of the particles with acid/base properties in `pmb.df`
1708        
1709        Returns:
1710            pka_set(`dict`): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}
1711        '''
1712        titratables_AA_df = self.df[[('name',''),('pka',''),('acidity','')]].drop_duplicates().dropna()
1713        pka_set = {}
1714        for index in titratables_AA_df.name.keys():
1715            name = titratables_AA_df.name[index]
1716            pka_value = titratables_AA_df.pka[index]
1717            acidity = titratables_AA_df.acidity[index]   
1718            pka_set[name] = {'pka_value':pka_value,'acidity':acidity}
1719        return pka_set 
1720    
1721    def get_radius_map(self):
1722        '''
1723        Gets the diameter of each `espresso type` in `pmb.df`. 
1724        
1725        Returns:
1726            radius_map(`dict`): {espresso_type: radius}.
1727        '''
1728
1729        df_state_one = self.df[[('diameter',''),('state_one','es_type')]].dropna().drop_duplicates()
1730        df_state_two = self.df[[('diameter',''),('state_two','es_type')]].dropna().drop_duplicates()
1731
1732        state_one = self.pd.Series (df_state_one.diameter.values/2.0,index=df_state_one.state_one.es_type.values)
1733        state_two = self.pd.Series (df_state_two.diameter.values/2.0,index=df_state_two.state_two.es_type.values)
1734        radius_map  = self.pd.concat([state_one,state_two],axis=0).to_dict()
1735        
1736        return radius_map
1737
1738    def get_type_map(self):
1739        """
1740        Gets all different espresso types assigned to particles  in `pmb.df`.
1741        
1742        Returns:
1743            type_map(`dict`): {"name": espresso_type}.
1744        """
1745        if self.df.state_one['es_type'].isnull().values.any():         
1746            df_state_one = self.df.state_one.dropna(how='all')     
1747            df_state_two = self.df.state_two.dropna(how='all')  
1748        else:    
1749            df_state_one = self.df.state_one
1750            if self.df.state_two['es_type'].isnull().values.any():
1751                df_state_two = self.df.state_two.dropna(how='all')   
1752            else:
1753                df_state_two = self.df.state_two
1754        state_one = self.pd.Series (df_state_one.es_type.values,index=df_state_one.label)
1755        state_two = self.pd.Series (df_state_two.es_type.values,index=df_state_two.label)
1756        type_map  = self.pd.concat([state_one,state_two],axis=0).to_dict()
1757        return type_map
1758
1759    def load_interaction_parameters(self, filename, verbose=False):
1760        """
1761        Loads the interaction parameters stored in `filename` into `pmb.df`
1762        
1763        Args:
1764            filename(`str`): name of the file to be read
1765            verbose(`bool`): switches on/off the reading prints
1766        """
1767        from espressomd import interactions
1768        without_units = ['q','es_type','acidity']
1769        with_units = ['diameter','epsilon']
1770        with open(filename) as f:
1771            for line in f:
1772                if line[0] == '#':
1773                    continue
1774                param_dict=self.json.loads(line)
1775                object_type=param_dict['object_type']
1776                if object_type == 'particle':
1777                    not_requiered_attributes={}    
1778                    for not_requiered_key in without_units+with_units:
1779                        if not_requiered_key in param_dict.keys():
1780                            if not_requiered_key in with_units:
1781                                not_requiered_attributes[not_requiered_key]=self.create_variable_with_units(variable_dict=param_dict.pop(not_requiered_key))
1782                            elif not_requiered_key in without_units:
1783                                not_requiered_attributes[not_requiered_key]=param_dict.pop(not_requiered_key)
1784                        else:
1785                            if not_requiered_key == 'acidity':
1786                                not_requiered_attributes[not_requiered_key] = 'inert'
1787                            else:    
1788                                not_requiered_attributes[not_requiered_key]=None
1789                    self.define_particle(name=param_dict.pop('name'),
1790                                    q=not_requiered_attributes.pop('q'),
1791                                    diameter=not_requiered_attributes.pop('diameter'),
1792                                    acidity=not_requiered_attributes.pop('acidity'),
1793                                    epsilon=not_requiered_attributes.pop('epsilon'))
1794                elif object_type == 'residue':
1795                    self.define_residue (name = param_dict.pop('name'),
1796                                        central_bead = param_dict.pop('central_bead_name'),
1797                                        side_chains = param_dict.pop('side_chains_names'))
1798                elif object_type == 'molecule':
1799                    self.define_molecule(name=param_dict.pop('name'),
1800                                        residue_list=param_dict.pop('residue_name_list'))
1801                elif object_type == 'peptide':
1802                    self.define_peptide(name=param_dict.pop('name'),
1803                                        sequence=param_dict.pop('sequence'),
1804                                        model=param_dict.pop('model'))
1805                elif object_type == 'bond':
1806                    name1 = param_dict.pop('name1')
1807                    name2 = param_dict.pop('name2')
1808                    bond_type = param_dict.pop('bond_type')
1809                    if bond_type == 'harmonic':
1810                        k = self.create_variable_with_units(variable_dict=param_dict.pop('k'))
1811                        r_0 = self.create_variable_with_units(variable_dict=param_dict.pop('r_0'))
1812                        bond = interactions.HarmonicBond(k=k.to('reduced_energy / reduced_length**2').magnitude, r_0=r_0.to('reduced_length').magnitude)
1813                    elif bond_type == 'FENE':
1814                        k = self.create_variable_with_units(variable_dict=param_dict.pop('k'))
1815                        r_0 = self.create_variable_with_units(variable_dict=param_dict.pop('r_0'))
1816                        d_r_max = self.create_variable_with_units(variable_dict=param_dict.pop('d_r_max'))
1817                        bond = interactions.FeneBond(k=k.to('reduced_energy / reduced_length**2').magnitude, r_0=r_0.to('reduced_length').magnitude, d_r_max=d_r_max.to('reduced_length').magnitude)
1818                    else:
1819                        raise ValueError("Current implementation of pyMBE only supports harmonic and FENE bonds")
1820                    self.define_bond(bond_object=bond, bond_type=bond_type, particle_name1=name1, particle_name2=name2)
1821                else:
1822                    raise ValueError(object_type+' is not a known pmb object type')
1823                if verbose:
1824                    print('Added: '+line)
1825        return
1826    
1827    def load_pka_set(self,filename, verbose=False):
1828        """
1829        Loads the pka_set stored in `filename` into `pmb.df`.
1830        
1831        Args:
1832            filename(`str`): name of the file with the pka set to be loaded. Expected format is {name:{"acidity": acidity, "pka_value":pka_value}}.
1833            verbose(`bool`, optional): If activated, the function reports each pKa value loaded. Defaults to False
1834
1835        Note:
1836            - If `name` is already defined in the `pymbe.df`, it prints a warning.
1837        """
1838        pKa_list=[]
1839        with open(filename) as f:
1840            for line in f:
1841                if line[0] == '#':
1842                    continue
1843                param_dict=self.json.loads(line)
1844                pKa_list.append(param_dict)    
1845                if verbose:
1846                    print('Added: '+line)
1847        for pka_set in pKa_list:            
1848            self.check_pka_set(pka_set=pka_set)
1849            for pka_key in pka_set: 
1850                acidity =   pka_set[pka_key]['acidity']        
1851                pka_value = pka_set[pka_key]['pka_value']     
1852                self.define_particle(name=pka_key,acidity=acidity, pka=pka_value)
1853        return
1854
1855    def parse_sequence_from_file(self,sequence):
1856        """
1857        Parses the given sequence such that it can be used in pyMBE. This function has to be used if the df was read from a file.
1858
1859        Args:
1860            sequence(`str`): sequence to be parsed
1861
1862        Returns:
1863            sequence(`lst`): parsed sequence
1864        """
1865        sequence = sequence.replace(' ', '')
1866        sequence = sequence.replace("'", '')
1867        sequence = sequence.split(",")[1:-1]
1868        return sequence
1869
1870    def print_reduced_units(self):
1871        """
1872        Prints the  current set of reduced units defined in pyMBE.units.
1873        """
1874        print("\nCurrent set of reduced units:")
1875        unit_length=self.units.Quantity(1,'reduced_length')
1876        unit_energy=self.units.Quantity(1,'reduced_energy')
1877        unit_charge=self.units.Quantity(1,'reduced_charge')
1878        print(unit_length.to('nm'), "=", unit_length)
1879        print(unit_energy.to('J'), "=", unit_energy)
1880        print('Temperature:', (self.kT/self.Kb).to("K"))
1881        print(unit_charge.to('C'), "=", unit_charge)
1882        print()
1883
1884    def propose_unused_type(self):
1885        """
1886        Searches in `pmb.df` all the different particle types defined and returns a new one.
1887
1888        Returns:
1889            unused_type(`int`): unused particle type
1890        """
1891        type_map=self.get_type_map()
1892        if type_map == {}:    
1893            unused_type = 0
1894        else:
1895            unused_type=max(type_map.values())+1    
1896        return unused_type
1897
1898    def protein_sequence_parser(self, sequence):
1899        '''
1900        Parses `sequence` to the one letter code for amino acids.
1901        
1902        Args:
1903            sequence(`str` or `lst`): Sequence of the amino acid. 
1904
1905        Returns:
1906            clean_sequence(`lst`): `sequence` using the one letter code.
1907        
1908        Note:
1909            - Accepted formats for `sequence` are:
1910                - `lst` with one letter or three letter code of each aminoacid in each element
1911                - `str` with the sequence using the one letter code
1912                - `str` with the squence using the three letter code, each aminoacid must be separated by a hyphen "-"
1913        
1914        '''
1915        # Aminoacid key
1916        keys={"ALA": "A",
1917                "ARG": "R",
1918                "ASN": "N",
1919                "ASP": "D",
1920                "CYS": "C",
1921                "GLU": "E",
1922                "GLN": "Q",
1923                "GLY": "G",
1924                "HIS": "H",
1925                "ILE": "I",
1926                "LEU": "L",
1927                "LYS": "K",
1928                "MET": "M",
1929                "PHE": "F",
1930                "PRO": "P",
1931                "SER": "S",
1932                "THR": "T",
1933                "TRP": "W",
1934                "TYR": "Y",
1935                "VAL": "V",
1936                "PSER": "J",
1937                "PTHR": "U",
1938                "PTyr": "Z",
1939                "NH2": "n",
1940                "COOH": "c"}
1941        clean_sequence=[]
1942        if isinstance(sequence, str):
1943            if (sequence.find("-") != -1):
1944                splited_sequence=sequence.split("-")
1945                for residue in splited_sequence:
1946                    if len(residue) == 1:
1947                        if residue in keys.values():
1948                            residue_ok=residue
1949                        else:
1950                            if residue.upper() in keys.values():
1951                                residue_ok=residue.upper()
1952                            else:
1953                                raise ValueError("Unknown one letter code for a residue given: ", residue, " please review the input sequence")
1954                        clean_sequence.append(residue_ok)
1955                    else:
1956                        if residue in keys.keys():
1957                            clean_sequence.append(keys[residue])
1958                        else:
1959                            if (residue.upper() in keys.keys()):
1960                                clean_sequence.append(keys[residue.upper()])
1961                            else:
1962                                raise ValueError("Unknown  code for a residue: ", residue, " please review the input sequence")
1963            else:
1964                for residue in sequence:
1965                    if residue in keys.values():
1966                        residue_ok=residue
1967                    else:
1968                        if residue.upper() in keys.values():
1969                            residue_ok=residue.upper()
1970                        else:
1971                            raise ValueError("Unknown one letter code for a residue: ", residue, " please review the input sequence")
1972                    clean_sequence.append(residue_ok)
1973        if isinstance(sequence, list):
1974            for residue in sequence:
1975                    if residue in keys.values():
1976                        residue_ok=residue
1977                    else:
1978                        if residue.upper() in keys.values():
1979                            residue_ok=residue.upper()
1980                        elif (residue.upper() in keys.keys()):
1981                            clean_sequence.append(keys[residue.upper()])
1982                        else:
1983                            raise ValueError("Unknown code for a residue: ", residue, " please review the input sequence")
1984                    clean_sequence.append(residue_ok)
1985        return clean_sequence
1986    
1987    def read_pmb_df (self,filename):
1988        """
1989        Reads a pyMBE's Dataframe stored in `filename` and stores the information into pyMBE.
1990
1991        Args:
1992            filename(str): path to file.
1993
1994        Note:
1995            This function only accepts files with CSV format. 
1996        """
1997        if filename[-3:] != "csv":
1998            raise ValueError("Only files with CSV format are supported")
1999        df = self.pd.read_csv (filename,header=[0, 1], index_col=0)
2000        columns_names = self.setup_df()
2001        df.columns = columns_names
2002        self.df=df
2003        return df
2004    
2005    def read_protein_vtf_in_df (self,filename,unit_length=None):
2006        """
2007        Loads a coarse-grained protein model in a vtf file `filename` into the `pmb.df` and it labels it with `name`.
2008
2009        Args:
2010            filename(`str`): Path to the vtf file with the coarse-grained model.
2011            unit_length(`obj`): unit of length of the the coordinates in `filename` using the pyMBE UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
2012
2013        Returns:
2014            topology_dict(`dict`): {'initial_pos': coords_list, 'chain_id': id, 'diameter': diameter_value}
2015
2016        Note:
2017            - If no `unit_length` is provided, it is assumed that the coordinates are in Angstrom.
2018        """
2019
2020        print (f'Loading protein coarse grain model file: {filename}')
2021
2022        coord_list = []
2023        particles_dict = {}
2024
2025        if unit_length == None:
2026            unit_length = 1 * self.units.angstrom 
2027
2028        with open (filename,'r') as protein_model:
2029
2030                for line in protein_model :
2031                    line_split = line.split ()
2032    
2033                    if line_split : 
2034                        line_header = line_split [0]
2035
2036                        if line_header == 'atom':
2037
2038                            atom_id  = line_split [1]
2039                            atom_name = line_split [3]
2040                            atom_resname = line_split [5]
2041                            chain_id = line_split [9]
2042
2043                            particles_dict [int(atom_id)] = [atom_name , atom_resname, chain_id]
2044         
2045                        elif line_header.isnumeric (): 
2046
2047                            atom_coord = line_split [1:] 
2048                            atom_coord = [(float(i)*unit_length).to('reduced_length').magnitude for i in atom_coord]
2049                            coord_list.append (atom_coord)
2050
2051        numbered_label = []
2052        i = 0   
2053        
2054        for atom_id in particles_dict.keys():
2055    
2056            if atom_id == 1:
2057                atom_name = particles_dict[atom_id][0]
2058                numbered_name = [f'{atom_name}{i}',particles_dict[atom_id][2]]
2059                numbered_label.append(numbered_name)
2060
2061            elif atom_id != 1: 
2062            
2063                if particles_dict[atom_id-1][1] != particles_dict[atom_id][1]:
2064                    i += 1                    
2065                    count = 1
2066                    atom_name = particles_dict[atom_id][0]
2067                    numbered_name = [f'{atom_name}{i}',particles_dict[atom_id][2]]
2068                    numbered_label.append(numbered_name)
2069                    
2070                elif particles_dict[atom_id-1][1] == particles_dict[atom_id][1]:
2071                    if count == 2 or particles_dict[atom_id][1] == 'GLY':
2072                        i +=1  
2073                        count = 0
2074                    atom_name = particles_dict[atom_id][0]
2075                    numbered_name = [f'{atom_name}{i}',particles_dict[atom_id][2]]
2076                    numbered_label.append(numbered_name)
2077                    count +=1
2078
2079        topology_dict = {}
2080
2081        for i in range (0, len(numbered_label)):   
2082            topology_dict [numbered_label[i][0]] = {'initial_pos': coord_list[i] ,'chain_id':numbered_label[i][1] }
2083
2084        return topology_dict
2085
2086    def search_bond(self, particle_name1, particle_name2, hard_check=False, use_default_bond=False) :
2087        """
2088        Searches for bonds between the particle types given by `particle_name1` and `particle_name2` in `pymbe.df` and returns it.
2089        If `use_default_bond` is activated and a "default" bond is defined, returns that default bond instead.
2090        If no bond is found, it prints a message and it does not return anything. If `hard_check` is activated, the code stops if no bond is found.
2091
2092        Args:
2093            particle_name1 (str): label of the type of the first particle type of the bonded particles.
2094            particle_name2 (str): label of the type of the second particle type of the bonded particles.
2095            hard_check (bool, optional): If it is activated, the code stops if no bond is found. Defaults to False. 
2096            use_default_bond (bool, optional): If it is activated, the "default" bond is returned if no bond is found between `particle_name1` and `particle_name2`. Defaults to False. 
2097
2098        Returns:
2099            bond (cls): bond object from the espressomd library.
2100        
2101        Note:
2102            - If `use_default_bond`=True and no bond is defined between `particle_name1` and `particle_name2`, it returns the default bond defined in `pmb.df`.
2103            - If `hard_check`=`True` stops the code when no bond is found.
2104        """
2105        bond_key = self.find_bond_key(particle_name1=particle_name1, 
2106                                    particle_name2=particle_name2, 
2107                                    use_default_bond=use_default_bond)
2108        if bond_key:
2109            return self.df[self.df['name']==bond_key].bond_object.values[0]
2110        else:
2111            print("Bond not defined between particles ", particle_name1, " and ", particle_name2)    
2112            if hard_check:
2113                exit()
2114            else:
2115                return
2116
2117    def search_particles_in_residue(self, residue_name):
2118        '''
2119        Searches for all particles in a given residue of name `residue_name`.
2120
2121        Args:
2122            residue_name (`str`): name of the residue to be searched
2123
2124        Returns:
2125            list_of_particles_in_residue (`lst`): list of the names of all particles in the residue
2126
2127        Note:
2128            - The function returns a name per particle in residue, i.e. if there are multiple particles with the same type `list_of_particles_in_residue` will have repeated items.
2129 
2130        '''
2131        index_residue = self.df.loc[self.df['name'] == residue_name].index[0].item() 
2132        central_bead = self.df.at [index_residue, ('central_bead', '')]
2133        list_of_side_chains = self.df.at [index_residue, ('side_chains', '')]
2134
2135        list_of_particles_in_residue = []
2136        list_of_particles_in_residue.append(central_bead)
2137
2138        for side_chain in list_of_side_chains: 
2139            object_type = self.df[self.df['name']==side_chain].pmb_type.values[0]
2140
2141            if object_type == "residue":
2142                list_of_particles_in_side_chain_residue = self.search_particles_in_residue(side_chain)
2143                list_of_particles_in_residue += list_of_particles_in_side_chain_residue
2144            elif object_type == "particle":
2145                list_of_particles_in_residue.append(side_chain)
2146
2147        return list_of_particles_in_residue
2148
2149    def set_particle_acidity(self, name, acidity='inert', default_charge=0, pka=None):
2150        """
2151        Sets the particle acidity if it is acidic or basic, creates `state_one` and `state_two` with the protonated and 
2152        deprotonated states. In each state is set: `label`,`charge` and `es_type`. If it is inert, it will define only `state_one`.
2153
2154        Args:
2155            name (`str`): Unique label that identifies the `particle`. 
2156            acidity (`str`): Identifies whether the particle is `acidic` or `basic`, used to setup constant pH simulations. Defaults to `inert`.
2157            default_charge (`int`): Charge of the particle. Defaults to 0.
2158            pka (`float`, optional):  If `particle` is an acid or a base, it defines its pka-value. Defaults to None.
2159        """
2160        acidity_valid_keys = ['inert','acidic', 'basic']
2161        if acidity not in acidity_valid_keys:
2162            raise ValueError(self.df[name].name +' provided acidity not supported, valid keys are ', acidity_valid_keys)   
2163        for index in self.df[self.df['name']==name].index:       
2164            if pka:
2165                self.add_value_to_df(key=('pka',''),index=index,new_value=pka)
2166            self.add_value_to_df(key=('acidity',''),index=index,new_value=acidity) 
2167            if not self.check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(index=index,key=('state_one','es_type')):
2168                self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_one','es_type'),index=index,new_value=self.propose_unused_type())  
2169            if self.df.loc [self.df['name']  == name].acidity.iloc[0] == 'inert':
2170                self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_one','charge'),index=index,new_value=default_charge)
2171                self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_one','label'),index=index,new_value=name)
2172            else:
2173                protonated_label = f'{name}H'
2174                self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_one','label'),index=index,new_value=protonated_label)
2175                self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_two','label'),index=index,new_value=name)
2176                if not self.check_if_df_cell_has_a_value(index=index,key=('state_two','es_type')):
2177                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_two','es_type'),index=index,new_value=self.propose_unused_type())
2178                if self.df.loc [self.df['name']  == name].acidity.iloc[0] == 'acidic':        
2179                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_one','charge'),index=index,new_value=0)
2180                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_two','charge'),index=index,new_value=-1)
2181                elif self.df.loc [self.df['name']  == name].acidity.iloc[0] == 'basic':
2182                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_one','charge'),index=index,new_value=+1)
2183                    self.add_value_to_df(key=('state_two','charge'),index=index,new_value=0)   
2184        return
2185    
2186    def set_reduced_units(self, unit_length=None, unit_charge=None, temperature=None):
2187        """
2188        Sets the set of reduced units used by pyMBE.units and it prints it.
2189
2190        Args:
2191            unit_length (`obj`,optional): Reduced unit of length defined using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. Defaults to None. 
2192            unit_charge (`obj`,optional): Reduced unit of charge defined using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. Defaults to None. 
2193            temperature (`obj`,optional): Temperature of the system, defined using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. Defaults to None. 
2194
2195        Note:
2196            - If no `temperature` is given, a value of 298.15 K is assumed by default.
2197            - If no `unit_length` is given, a value of 0.355 nm is assumed by default.
2198            - If no `unit_charge` is given, a value of 1 elementary charge is assumed by default. 
2199        """
2200        self.units=self.pint.UnitRegistry()
2201        if unit_length is None:
2202            unit_length=0.355*self.units.nm
2203        if temperature is None:
2204            temperature=298.15 * self.units.K
2205        if unit_charge is None:
2206            unit_charge=self.units.e
2207        self.N_A=6.02214076e23 / self.units.mol
2208        self.Kb=1.38064852e-23 * self.units.J / self.units.K
2209        self.e=1.60217662e-19 *self.units.C
2210        self.kT=temperature*self.Kb
2211        self.units.define(f'reduced_energy = {self.kT} ')
2212        self.units.define(f'reduced_length = {unit_length}')
2213        self.units.define(f'reduced_charge = {unit_charge}')        
2214        self.print_reduced_units()
2215        return
2216
2217    def setup_cpH (self, counter_ion, constant_pH, SEED, exclusion_range=None, pka_set=None, use_exclusion_radius_per_type = False):
2218        """
2219        Sets up the Acid/Base reactions for acidic/basic `particles` defined in `pmb.df` to be sampled in the constant pH ensemble. 
2220
2221        Args:
2222            counter_ion(`str`): `name` of the counter_ion `particle`.
2223            constant_pH(`float`): pH-value.
2224            SEED(`int`): Seed for the random number generator.
2225            exclusion_range(`float`, optional): Below this value, no particles will be inserted.
2226            use_exclusion_radius_per_type(`bool`,optional): Controls if one exclusion_radius for each espresso_type is used. Defaults to `False`.
2227            pka_set(`dict`,optional): Desired pka_set, pka_set(`dict`): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}. Defaults to None.
2228
2229        Returns:
2230            RE (`obj`): Instance of a reaction_ensemble.ConstantpHEnsemble object from the espressomd library.
2231            sucessfull_reactions_labels(`lst`): Labels of the reactions set up by pyMBE.
2232        """
2233        from espressomd import reaction_methods
2234        if exclusion_range is None:
2235            exclusion_range = max(self.get_radius_map().values())*2.0
2236        if pka_set is None:
2237            pka_set=self.get_pka_set()    
2238        self.check_pka_set(pka_set=pka_set)
2239        if use_exclusion_radius_per_type:
2240            exclusion_radius_per_type = self.get_radius_map()
2241        else:
2242            exclusion_radius_per_type = {}
2243        
2244        RE = reaction_methods.ConstantpHEnsemble(kT=self.kT.to('reduced_energy').magnitude,
2245                                                    exclusion_range=exclusion_range.magnitude, 
2246                                                    seed=SEED, 
2247                                                    constant_pH=constant_pH,
2248                                                    exclusion_radius_per_type = exclusion_radius_per_type
2249                                                    )
2250        sucessfull_reactions_labels=[]
2251        charge_map = self.get_charge_map()
2252        for name in pka_set.keys():
2253            if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='particle') is False :
2254                print('WARNING: the acid-base reaction of ' + name +' has not been set up because its espresso type is not defined in sg.type_map')
2255                continue
2256            gamma=10**-pka_set[name]['pka_value']
2257            state_one_type   = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_one.es_type.values[0]
2258            state_two_type   = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_two.es_type.values[0]
2259            counter_ion_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==counter_ion].state_one.es_type.values[0]
2260            RE.add_reaction(gamma=gamma,
2261                            reactant_types=[state_one_type],
2262                            product_types=[state_two_type, counter_ion_type],
2263                            default_charges={state_one_type: charge_map[state_one_type],
2264                            state_two_type: charge_map[state_two_type],
2265                            counter_ion_type: charge_map[counter_ion_type]})
2266            sucessfull_reactions_labels.append(name)
2267        return RE, sucessfull_reactions_labels
2268
2269    def setup_grxmc_reactions(self, pH_res, c_salt_res, proton_name, hydroxide_name, salt_cation_name, salt_anion_name, SEED, activity_coefficient=None, exclusion_range=None, pka_set=None, use_exclusion_radius_per_type = False):
2270        """
2271        Sets up Acid/Base reactions for acidic/basic 'particles' defined in 'pmb.df', as well as a grand-canonical coupling to a 
2272        reservoir of small ions. 
2273        This implementation uses the original formulation of the grand-reaction method by Landsgesell et al. [1].
2274
2275        [1] Landsgesell, J., Hebbeker, P., Rud, O., Lunkad, R., Košovan, P., & Holm, C. (2020). Grand-reaction method for simulations of ionization equilibria coupled to ion partitioning. Macromolecules, 53(8), 3007-3020.
2276
2277        Args:
2278            pH_res ('float): pH-value in the reservoir.
2279            c_salt_res ('float'): Concentration of monovalent salt (e.g. NaCl) in the reservoir.
2280            proton_name ('str'): Name of the proton (H+) particle.
2281            hydroxide_name ('str'): Name of the hydroxide (OH-) particle.
2282            salt_cation_name ('str'): Name of the salt cation (e.g. Na+) particle.
2283            salt_anion_name ('str'): Name of the salt anion (e.g. Cl-) particle.
2284            SEED ('int'): Seed for the random number generator.
2285            activity_coefficient ('callable', optional): A function that calculates the activity coefficient of an ion pair as a function of the ionic strength.
2286            exclusion_range(`float`, optional): For distances shorter than this value, no particles will be inserted.
2287            pka_set(`dict`,optional): Desired pka_set, pka_set(`dict`): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}. Defaults to None.
2288            use_exclusion_radius_per_type(`bool`,optional): Controls if one exclusion_radius for each espresso_type is used. Defaults to `False`.
2289
2290        Returns:
2291            RE (`obj`): Instance of a reaction_ensemble.ReactionEnsemble object from the espressomd library.
2292            sucessful_reactions_labels(`lst`): Labels of the reactions set up by pyMBE.
2293            ionic_strength_res ('float'): Ionic strength of the reservoir (useful for calculating partition coefficients).
2294        """
2295        from espressomd import reaction_methods
2296        if exclusion_range is None:
2297            exclusion_range = max(self.get_radius_map().values())*2.0
2298        if pka_set is None:
2299            pka_set=self.get_pka_set()    
2300        self.check_pka_set(pka_set=pka_set)
2301        if use_exclusion_radius_per_type:
2302            exclusion_radius_per_type = self.get_radius_map()
2303        else:
2304            exclusion_radius_per_type = {}
2305        
2306        #If no function for the activity coefficient is provided, the ideal case is assumed.
2307        if activity_coefficient is None:
2308            activity_coefficient = lambda x: 1.0
2309        
2310        RE = reaction_methods.ReactionEnsemble(kT=self.kT.to('reduced_energy').magnitude,
2311                                                    exclusion_range=exclusion_range.magnitude, 
2312                                                    seed=SEED, 
2313                                                    exclusion_radius_per_type = exclusion_radius_per_type
2314                                                    )
2315
2316        # Determine the concentrations of the various species in the reservoir and the equilibrium constants
2317        cH_res, cOH_res, cNa_res, cCl_res = self.determine_reservoir_concentrations(pH_res, c_salt_res, activity_coefficient)
2318        ionic_strength_res = 0.5*(cNa_res+cCl_res+cOH_res+cH_res)
2319        determined_activity_coefficient = activity_coefficient(ionic_strength_res)
2320        K_W = cH_res.to('1/(N_A * reduced_length**3)') * cOH_res.to('1/(N_A * reduced_length**3)') * determined_activity_coefficient
2321        K_NACL = cNa_res.to('1/(N_A * reduced_length**3)') * cCl_res.to('1/(N_A * reduced_length**3)') * determined_activity_coefficient
2322        K_HCL = cH_res.to('1/(N_A * reduced_length**3)') * cCl_res.to('1/(N_A * reduced_length**3)') * determined_activity_coefficient
2323
2324        proton_es_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==proton_name].state_one.es_type.values[0]
2325        hydroxide_es_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==hydroxide_name].state_one.es_type.values[0]     
2326        salt_cation_es_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==salt_cation_name].state_one.es_type.values[0]
2327        salt_anion_es_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==salt_anion_name].state_one.es_type.values[0]     
2328
2329        proton_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==proton_name].state_one.charge.values[0]
2330        hydroxide_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==hydroxide_name].state_one.charge.values[0]     
2331        salt_cation_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==salt_cation_name].state_one.charge.values[0]
2332        salt_anion_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==salt_anion_name].state_one.charge.values[0]     
2333
2334        if proton_charge <= 0:
2335            raise ValueError('ERROR proton charge must be positive, charge ', proton_charge)
2336        if salt_cation_charge <= 0:
2337            raise ValueError('ERROR salt cation charge must be positive, charge ', salt_cation_charge)
2338        if hydroxide_charge >= 0:
2339            raise ValueError('ERROR hydroxide charge must be negative, charge ', hydroxide_charge)
2340        if salt_anion_charge >= 0:
2341            raise ValueError('ERROR salt anion charge must be negative, charge ', salt_anion_charge)
2342
2343        # Grand-canonical coupling to the reservoir
2344        # 0 = H+ + OH-
2345        RE.add_reaction(
2346            gamma = K_W.magnitude,
2347            reactant_types = [],
2348            reactant_coefficients = [],
2349            product_types = [ proton_es_type, hydroxide_es_type ],
2350            product_coefficients = [ 1, 1 ],
2351            default_charges = {
2352                proton_es_type: proton_charge, 
2353                hydroxide_es_type: hydroxide_charge, 
2354            }
2355        )
2356
2357        # 0 = Na+ + Cl-
2358        RE.add_reaction(
2359            gamma = K_NACL.magnitude,
2360            reactant_types = [],
2361            reactant_coefficients = [],
2362            product_types = [ salt_cation_es_type, salt_anion_es_type ],
2363            product_coefficients = [ 1, 1 ],
2364            default_charges = {
2365                salt_cation_es_type: salt_cation_charge, 
2366                salt_anion_es_type: salt_anion_charge, 
2367            }
2368        )
2369
2370        # 0 = Na+ + OH-
2371        RE.add_reaction(
2372            gamma = (K_NACL * K_W / K_HCL).magnitude,
2373            reactant_types = [],
2374            reactant_coefficients = [],
2375            product_types = [ salt_cation_es_type, hydroxide_es_type ],
2376            product_coefficients = [ 1, 1 ],
2377            default_charges = {
2378                salt_cation_es_type: salt_cation_charge, 
2379                hydroxide_es_type: hydroxide_charge, 
2380            }
2381        )
2382
2383        # 0 = H+ + Cl-
2384        RE.add_reaction(
2385            gamma = K_HCL.magnitude,
2386            reactant_types = [],
2387            reactant_coefficients = [],
2388            product_types = [ proton_es_type, salt_anion_es_type ],
2389            product_coefficients = [ 1, 1 ],
2390            default_charges = {
2391                proton_es_type: proton_charge, 
2392                salt_anion_es_type: salt_anion_charge, 
2393            }
2394        )
2395
2396        # Annealing moves to ensure sufficient sampling
2397        # Cation annealing H+ = Na+
2398        RE.add_reaction(
2399            gamma = (K_NACL / K_HCL).magnitude,
2400            reactant_types = [proton_es_type],
2401            reactant_coefficients = [ 1 ],
2402            product_types = [ salt_cation_es_type ],
2403            product_coefficients = [ 1 ],
2404            default_charges = {
2405                proton_es_type: proton_charge, 
2406                salt_cation_es_type: salt_cation_charge, 
2407            }
2408        )
2409
2410        # Anion annealing OH- = Cl- 
2411        RE.add_reaction(
2412            gamma = (K_HCL / K_W).magnitude,
2413            reactant_types = [hydroxide_es_type],
2414            reactant_coefficients = [ 1 ],
2415            product_types = [ salt_anion_es_type ],
2416            product_coefficients = [ 1 ],
2417            default_charges = {
2418                hydroxide_es_type: hydroxide_charge, 
2419                salt_anion_es_type: salt_anion_charge, 
2420            }
2421        )
2422
2423        sucessful_reactions_labels=[]
2424        charge_map = self.get_charge_map()
2425        for name in pka_set.keys():
2426            if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='particle') is False :
2427                print('WARNING: the acid-base reaction of ' + name +' has not been set up because its espresso type is not defined in the type map.')
2428                continue
2429
2430            Ka = (10**-pka_set[name]['pka_value'] * self.units.mol/self.units.l).to('1/(N_A * reduced_length**3)')
2431
2432            state_one_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_one.es_type.values[0]
2433            state_two_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_two.es_type.values[0]
2434
2435            # Reaction in terms of proton: HA = A + H+
2436            RE.add_reaction(gamma=Ka.magnitude,
2437                            reactant_types=[state_one_type],
2438                            reactant_coefficients=[1],
2439                            product_types=[state_two_type, proton_es_type],
2440                            product_coefficients=[1, 1],
2441                            default_charges={state_one_type: charge_map[state_one_type],
2442                            state_two_type: charge_map[state_two_type],
2443                            proton_es_type: proton_charge})
2444
2445            # Reaction in terms of salt cation: HA = A + Na+
2446            RE.add_reaction(gamma=(Ka * K_NACL / K_HCL).magnitude,
2447                            reactant_types=[state_one_type],
2448                            reactant_coefficients=[1],
2449                            product_types=[state_two_type, salt_cation_es_type],
2450                            product_coefficients=[1, 1],
2451                            default_charges={state_one_type: charge_map[state_one_type],
2452                            state_two_type: charge_map[state_two_type],
2453                            salt_cation_es_type: salt_cation_charge})
2454
2455            # Reaction in terms of hydroxide: OH- + HA = A
2456            RE.add_reaction(gamma=(Ka / K_W).magnitude,
2457                            reactant_types=[state_one_type, hydroxide_es_type],
2458                            reactant_coefficients=[1, 1],
2459                            product_types=[state_two_type],
2460                            product_coefficients=[1],
2461                            default_charges={state_one_type: charge_map[state_one_type],
2462                            state_two_type: charge_map[state_two_type],
2463                            hydroxide_es_type: hydroxide_charge})
2464
2465            # Reaction in terms of salt anion: Cl- + HA = A
2466            RE.add_reaction(gamma=(Ka / K_HCL).magnitude,
2467                            reactant_types=[state_one_type, salt_anion_es_type],
2468                            reactant_coefficients=[1, 1],
2469                            product_types=[state_two_type],
2470                            product_coefficients=[1],
2471                            default_charges={state_one_type: charge_map[state_one_type],
2472                            state_two_type: charge_map[state_two_type],
2473                            salt_anion_es_type: salt_anion_charge})
2474
2475            sucessful_reactions_labels.append(name)
2476        return RE, sucessful_reactions_labels, ionic_strength_res
2477
2478    def setup_grxmc_unified (self, pH_res, c_salt_res, cation_name, anion_name, SEED, activity_coefficient=None, exclusion_range=None, pka_set=None, use_exclusion_radius_per_type = False):
2479        """
2480        Sets up Acid/Base reactions for acidic/basic 'particles' defined in 'pmb.df', as well as a grand-canonical coupling to a 
2481        reservoir of small ions. 
2482        This implementation uses the formulation of the grand-reaction method by Curk et al. [1], which relies on "unified" ion types X+ = {H+, Na+} and X- = {OH-, Cl-}. 
2483        A function that implements the original version of the grand-reaction method by Landsgesell et al. [2] is also available under the name 'setup_grxmc_reactions'.
2484
2485        [1] Curk, T., Yuan, J., & Luijten, E. (2022). Accelerated simulation method for charge regulation effects. The Journal of Chemical Physics, 156(4).
2486        [2] Landsgesell, J., Hebbeker, P., Rud, O., Lunkad, R., Košovan, P., & Holm, C. (2020). Grand-reaction method for simulations of ionization equilibria coupled to ion partitioning. Macromolecules, 53(8), 3007-3020.
2487
2488        Args:
2489            pH_res ('float'): pH-value in the reservoir.
2490            c_salt_res ('float'): Concentration of monovalent salt (e.g. NaCl) in the reservoir.
2491            cation_name ('str'): Name of the cationic particle.
2492            anion_name ('str'): Name of the anionic particle.
2493            SEED ('int'): Seed for the random number generator.
2494            activity_coefficient ('callable', optional): A function that calculates the activity coefficient of an ion pair as a function of the ionic strength.
2495            exclusion_range(`float`, optional): Below this value, no particles will be inserted.
2496            pka_set(`dict`,optional): Desired pka_set, pka_set(`dict`): {"name" : {"pka_value": pka, "acidity": acidity}}. Defaults to None.
2497            use_exclusion_radius_per_type(`bool`,optional): Controls if one exclusion_radius per each espresso_type. Defaults to `False`.
2498
2499        Returns:
2500            RE (`obj`): Instance of a reaction_ensemble.ReactionEnsemble object from the espressomd library.
2501            sucessful_reactions_labels(`lst`): Labels of the reactions set up by pyMBE.
2502            ionic_strength_res ('float'): Ionic strength of the reservoir (useful for calculating partition coefficients).
2503        """
2504        from espressomd import reaction_methods
2505        if exclusion_range is None:
2506            exclusion_range = max(self.get_radius_map().values())*2.0
2507        if pka_set is None:
2508            pka_set=self.get_pka_set()    
2509        self.check_pka_set(pka_set=pka_set)
2510        if use_exclusion_radius_per_type:
2511            exclusion_radius_per_type = self.get_radius_map()
2512        else:
2513            exclusion_radius_per_type = {}
2514        
2515        #If no function for the activity coefficient is provided, the ideal case is assumed.
2516        if activity_coefficient is None:
2517            activity_coefficient = lambda x: 1.0
2518        
2519        RE = reaction_methods.ReactionEnsemble(kT=self.kT.to('reduced_energy').magnitude,
2520                                                    exclusion_range=exclusion_range.magnitude, 
2521                                                    seed=SEED, 
2522                                                    exclusion_radius_per_type = exclusion_radius_per_type
2523                                                    )
2524
2525        # Determine the concentrations of the various species in the reservoir and the equilibrium constants
2526        cH_res, cOH_res, cNa_res, cCl_res = self.determine_reservoir_concentrations(pH_res, c_salt_res, activity_coefficient)
2527        ionic_strength_res = 0.5*(cNa_res+cCl_res+cOH_res+cH_res)
2528        determined_activity_coefficient = activity_coefficient(ionic_strength_res)
2529        a_hydrogen = (10 ** (-pH_res) * self.units.mol/self.units.l).to('1/(N_A * reduced_length**3)')
2530        a_cation = (cH_res+cNa_res).to('1/(N_A * reduced_length**3)') * self.np.sqrt(determined_activity_coefficient)
2531        a_anion = (cH_res+cNa_res).to('1/(N_A * reduced_length**3)') * self.np.sqrt(determined_activity_coefficient)
2532        K_XX = a_cation * a_anion
2533
2534        cation_es_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==cation_name].state_one.es_type.values[0]
2535        anion_es_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==anion_name].state_one.es_type.values[0]     
2536        cation_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==cation_name].state_one.charge.values[0]
2537        anion_charge = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==anion_name].state_one.charge.values[0]     
2538        if cation_charge <= 0:
2539            raise ValueError('ERROR cation charge must be positive, charge ', cation_charge)
2540        if anion_charge >= 0:
2541            raise ValueError('ERROR anion charge must be negative, charge ', anion_charge)
2542
2543        # Coupling to the reservoir: 0 = X+ + X-
2544        RE.add_reaction(
2545            gamma = K_XX.magnitude,
2546            reactant_types = [],
2547            reactant_coefficients = [],
2548            product_types = [ cation_es_type, anion_es_type ],
2549            product_coefficients = [ 1, 1 ],
2550            default_charges = {
2551                cation_es_type: cation_charge, 
2552                anion_es_type: anion_charge, 
2553            }
2554        )
2555
2556        sucessful_reactions_labels=[]
2557        charge_map = self.get_charge_map()
2558        for name in pka_set.keys():
2559            if self.check_if_name_is_defined_in_df(name,pmb_type_to_be_defined='particle') is False :
2560                print('WARNING: the acid-base reaction of ' + name +' has not been set up because its espresso type is not defined in sg.type_map')
2561                continue
2562
2563            Ka = 10**-pka_set[name]['pka_value'] * self.units.mol/self.units.l
2564            gamma_K_AX = Ka.to('1/(N_A * reduced_length**3)').magnitude * a_cation / a_hydrogen
2565
2566            state_one_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_one.es_type.values[0]
2567            state_two_type = self.df.loc[self.df['name']==name].state_two.es_type.values[0]
2568
2569            # Reaction in terms of small cation: HA = A + X+
2570            RE.add_reaction(gamma=gamma_K_AX.magnitude,
2571                            reactant_types=[state_one_type],
2572                            reactant_coefficients=[1],
2573                            product_types=[state_two_type, cation_es_type],
2574                            product_coefficients=[1, 1],
2575                            default_charges={state_one_type: charge_map[state_one_type],
2576                            state_two_type: charge_map[state_two_type],
2577                            cation_es_type: cation_charge})
2578
2579            # Reaction in terms of small anion: X- + HA = A
2580            RE.add_reaction(gamma=gamma_K_AX.magnitude / K_XX.magnitude,
2581                            reactant_types=[state_one_type, anion_es_type],
2582                            reactant_coefficients=[1, 1],
2583                            product_types=[state_two_type],
2584                            product_coefficients=[1],
2585                            default_charges={state_one_type: charge_map[state_one_type],
2586                            state_two_type: charge_map[state_two_type],
2587                            anion_es_type: anion_charge})
2588
2589            sucessful_reactions_labels.append(name)
2590        return RE, sucessful_reactions_labels, ionic_strength_res
2591
2592    def setup_df (self):
2593        """
2594        Sets up the pyMBE's dataframe `pymbe.df`.
2595
2596        Returns:
2597            columns_names(`obj`): pandas multiindex object with the column names of the pyMBE's dataframe
2598        """
2599
2600        columns_names = self.pd.MultiIndex.from_tuples ([
2601                        ('name',''),
2602                        ('pmb_type',''),
2603                        ('particle_id',''), 
2604                        ('particle_id2',''),
2605                        ('residue_id',''),
2606                        ('molecule_id',''),
2607                        ('acidity',''),
2608                        ('pka',''),
2609                        ('central_bead',''),
2610                        ('side_chains',''),
2611                        ('residue_list',''),
2612                        ('model',''),
2613                        ('diameter',''),
2614                        ('epsilon',''),
2615                        ('state_one','label'),
2616                        ('state_one','es_type'),
2617                        ('state_one','charge'),
2618                        ('state_two','label'),
2619                        ('state_two','es_type'),
2620                        ('state_two','charge'),
2621                        ('sequence',''),
2622                        ('bond_object',''),
2623                        ('parameters_of_the_potential','')
2624                        ])
2625
2626        self.df = self.pd.DataFrame (columns = columns_names)
2627      
2628        return columns_names
2629
2630    def setup_lj_interactions (self, espresso_system, cutoff=None, shift='auto', combining_rule='Lorentz-Berthelot'):
2631        """
2632        Sets up the Lennard-Jones (LJ) potential between all pairs of particle types with values for `diameter` and `epsilon` stored in `pymbe.df`.
2633        Stores the parameters loaded into ESPResSo for each type pair in `pymbe.df`.
2634        Assumes that the LJ interactions between all particles will have the same `cutoff`, `shift` and `combining_rule`.
2635        Check the documentation of ESPResSo for more info about the potential https://espressomd.github.io/doc4.2.0/inter_non-bonded.html
2636
2637        Args:
2638            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
2639            cutoff(`float`, optional): cut-off length of the LJ potential. Defaults to None.
2640            shift (`string`, optional): If set to `auto` shifts the potential to be continous at `cutoff`. Defaults to `auto`.
2641            combining_rule (`string`, optional): combining rule used to calculate `sigma` and `epsilon` for the potential betwen a pair of particles. Defaults to 'Lorentz-Berthelot'.
2642
2643        Note:
2644            If no `cutoff`  is given, its value is set to 2**(1./6.) in reduced_length units, corresponding to a purely steric potential.
2645
2646        Note:
2647            Currently, the only `combining_rule` supported is Lorentz-Berthelot.
2648        """
2649        from itertools import combinations_with_replacement
2650        sigma=1*self.units('reduced_length')
2651        implemented_combinatiorial_rules = ['Lorentz-Berthelot']
2652        compulsory_parameters_in_df = ['diameter','epsilon']
2653        if combining_rule not in implemented_combinatiorial_rules:
2654            raise ValueError('In the current version of pyMBE, the only combinatorial rules implemented are ', implemented_combinatiorial_rules)
2655        if cutoff is None:
2656            cutoff=2**(1./6.)*self.units('reduced_length')
2657        particles_types_with_LJ_parameters = []
2658        non_parametrized_labels= []
2659        for particle_type in self.get_type_map().values():
2660            check_list=[]
2661            for key in compulsory_parameters_in_df:
2662                value_in_df=self.find_value_from_es_type(es_type=particle_type,
2663                                                        column_name=key)
2664                check_list.append(self.np.isnan(value_in_df))
2665            if any(check_list):
2666                non_parametrized_labels.append(self.find_value_from_es_type(es_type=particle_type, 
2667                                                                            column_name='label'))
2668            else:
2669                particles_types_with_LJ_parameters.append(particle_type)
2670        for type_pair in combinations_with_replacement(particles_types_with_LJ_parameters, 2):
2671            diameter_list=[]
2672            epsilon_list=[]
2673            label_list=[]
2674            Non_interacting_pair=False
2675            # Search the LJ parameters of the type pair
2676            for ptype in type_pair:
2677                diameter=self.find_value_from_es_type(es_type=ptype, column_name='diameter').to('reduced_length').magnitude
2678                label=self.find_value_from_es_type(es_type=ptype, column_name='label')
2679                epsilon=self.find_value_from_es_type(es_type=ptype, column_name='epsilon').to('reduced_energy').magnitude
2680                if diameter == 0:
2681                    Non_interacting_pair=True
2682                    break
2683                elif diameter < 0:
2684                    raise ValueError(f"Particle {label} has a negative diameter = {diameter}, check your pmb.df")
2685                else:   
2686                    label_list.append(label)
2687                    diameter_list.append(diameter)
2688                    epsilon_list.append(epsilon)
2689            # If the diameter of one of the particle types is 0, no LJ interaction is setup
2690            if Non_interacting_pair:
2691                pass
2692            if combining_rule == 'Lorentz-Berthelot':
2693                diameter_sum=self.np.sum(diameter_list)
2694                epsilon=self.np.sqrt(self.np.prod(epsilon_list))
2695                offset=diameter_sum/2.-sigma.to('reduced_length').magnitude
2696            espresso_system.non_bonded_inter[type_pair[0],type_pair[1]].lennard_jones.set_params(epsilon = epsilon, 
2697                                                                                    sigma = sigma.to('reduced_length').magnitude, 
2698                                                                                    cutoff = cutoff.to('reduced_length').magnitude,
2699                                                                                    offset = offset, 
2700                                                                                    shift = shift)                                                                                          
2701            index = len(self.df)
2702            self.df.at [index, 'name'] = f'LJ: {label_list[0]}-{label_list[1]}'
2703            lj_params=espresso_system.non_bonded_inter[type_pair[0], type_pair[1]].lennard_jones.get_params()
2704            self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
2705                                key=('pmb_type',''),
2706                                new_value='LennardJones')
2707            self.add_value_to_df(index=index,
2708                                key=('parameters_of_the_potential',''),
2709                                new_value=self.json.dumps(lj_params))                
2710        if non_parametrized_labels:
2711            print(f'WARNING: No LJ interaction has been added in ESPResSo for particles with labels: {non_parametrized_labels}. Please, check your pmb.df to ensure if this is your desired setup.')
2712        return
2713
2714    def setup_particle_diameter(self, topology_dict):
2715        '''
2716        Sets up the diameter of the particles in `positions`.
2717
2718        Args:
2719            topology_dict(`dict`): {'initial_pos': coords_list, 'chain_id': id, 'diameter': diameter_value}
2720        '''
2721        for residue in topology_dict.keys():
2722            residue_name = self.re.split(r'\d+', residue)[0]
2723            residue_number = self.re.split(r'(\d+)', residue)[1]
2724            residue_diameter  = topology_dict[residue]['diameter']
2725            diameter = residue_diameter*self.units.nm
2726            index = self.df[(self.df['residue_id']==residue_number) & (self.df['name']==residue_name) ].index.values[0]
2727
2728            self.add_value_to_df(key= ('diameter',''),
2729                        index=int (index),
2730                        new_value=diameter)
2731            
2732        return 
2733
2734    def write_output_vtf_file(self, espresso_system, filename):
2735        '''
2736        Writes a snapshot of `espresso_system` on the vtf file `filename`.
2737
2738        Args:
2739            espresso_system(`obj`): Instance of a system object from the espressomd library.
2740            filename(`str`): Path to the vtf file.
2741
2742        '''
2743        box = espresso_system.box_l[0]
2744        with open(filename, mode='w+t') as coordinates:
2745            coordinates.write (f'unitcell {box} {box} {box} \n')
2746            for particle in espresso_system.part: 
2747                type_label = self.find_value_from_es_type(es_type=particle.type, column_name='label')
2748                coordinates.write (f'atom {particle.id} radius 1 name {type_label} type {type_label}\n' )
2749            coordinates.write (f'timestep indexed\n')
2750            for particle in espresso_system.part:
2751                coordinates.write (f'{particle.id} \t {particle.pos[0]} \t {particle.pos[1]} \t {particle.pos[2]}\n')
2752        return

The library for the Molecular Builder for ESPResSo (pyMBE)

Attributes:
  • N_A(obj): Avogadro number using the pmb.units UnitRegistry.
  • Kb(obj): Boltzmann constant using the pmb.units UnitRegistry.
  • e(obj): Elemental charge using the pmb.units UnitRegistry.
  • df(obj): PandasDataframe used to bookkeep all the information stored in pyMBE. Typically refered as pmb.df.
  • kT(obj): Thermal energy using the pmb.units UnitRegistry. It is used as the unit of reduced energy.
pymbe_library(temperature=None, unit_length=None, unit_charge=None) 
26    def __init__(self, temperature=None, unit_length=None, unit_charge=None):
27        """
28        Initializes the pymbe_library by setting up the reduced unit system with `temperature` and `reduced_length` 
29        and sets up  the `pmb.df` for bookkeeping.
30
31        Args:
32            temperature(`obj`,optional): Value of the temperature in the pyMBE UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
33            unit_length(`obj`, optional): Value of the unit of length in the pyMBE UnitRegistry. Defaults to None.
34            unit_charge (`obj`,optional): Reduced unit of charge defined using the `pmb.units` UnitRegistry. Defaults to None. 
35        
36        Note:
37            - If no `temperature` is given, a value of 298.15 K is assumed by default.
38            - If no `unit_length` is given, a value of 0.355 nm is assumed by default.
